items.content:
API Software Engineer (All Levels)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Developer APIs, Hospitality, SaaS
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Impala | No office location

Technologies

javascript
postgresql
mongodb
api-design
node.js

Job description

Impala is expanding it's engineering team to help us scale the platform that will power innovation in hospitality globally. You'll be joining a venture funded startup that is changing the way the hospitality industry works.

You'll be working directly on building new functionality into the product as well as working on existing features.

An engineer at Impala:

  • Takes ownership of features.
  • Wants to create great APIs for other developers to work with.
  • Spends time working on tooling to fix our common problems. In the past this has involved building chrome extensions and open source libraries.
  • Has a direct input in the formulation of functionality.
  • Cares enormously about developing professionally.

We are accepting fully remote applicants within Western Europe. An office stipend is provided to all employees and frequent travel to team meetings is paid.

All full-time employees will take equity stakes in the company.

Skills & Requirements

We're looking for engineers who are genuinely interested in using the latest web technologies when they're available. We're also looking for people who can build things well and also like to ship.

You won't be asked about linked lists or binary search trees in your interview but you will be asked about ES6 and APIs that you've worked with.

The recruitment process: 

  1. Make an application with us. Successful candidates will be contacted very quickly.
  2. Complete a 20 minutes initial interview with one of the team.
  3. Complete an 30 - 90 minute technical interview/pair programming session with our Lead Engineer.
  4. Have a final conversation with our co-founders. 

The process is extremely quick but we're highly selective.

What we need to see:

  • Experience in Node
  • Experience with relational databases (Postgres preferable)
  • Experience with NoSQL databases
  • An interest in taking ownership of functionality
  • Excellent, clear written & spoken English

What we'd love to see:

  • Experience with ReactJS
  • Experience with API design and development

Please note that we heavily favour candidates with a notice period of one month or less and those that include a cover letter. We will also ask you about remuneration in your first interview, we expect a single number that you are looking for. We will hardly ever off a lower salary than you ask for which means that we will judge you against what you ask for.

For more information on Impala, check out our articles covering:

What the hell is Impala anyway?

All about our culture

Apply now

About Impala

Impala is a small team, well-funded and growing quickly. In that way, we're similar to a lot of startups. In return for your hard work, we offer you:

  • A competitive salary and equity based on experience.
  • Frequent socials
  • Flexible working hours
  • The ability to work remotely
  • Time dedicated every Friday afternoon for personal projects, lightning talks and team events
  • A monthly allowance for books and other educational materials
  • The opportunity to work alongside a tight knit and driven team

Where we differ is:

  • You'll be working in a company led by an engineer. You won't be asked to do the unrealistic and your skills will be tested and improved.
  • You'll be working in a company that puts professional development front and centre.
  • You'll have a demonstrable, strong role in product direction.
  • We have an incredible culture (9.7 employee NPS).

Benefits

  • Remote work possible
  • Pick your own gear
  • Genuine product involvement
  • Lots of opportunities for travel
  • State of the art office space
  • Flexible holiday/working time

items.title: Family-Friendly team seeks Junior/Mid-Level Developer (JavaScript NodeJS React) at Spidergap
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=70, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=26, embedded=0, frontend=77}
items.content:
Family-Friendly team seeks Junior/Mid-Level Developer (JavaScript NodeJS React)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Human Resources
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Spidergap | No office location

Technologies

javascript
node.js
reactjs
html

Job description

At Spidergap, we’re starting to expand our development team.

This is a rare opportunity to join a very small, profitable and growing company that’s achieving great things while supporting a healthy work-life balance.

Our mission is to make it easy for companies of all sizes to support the personal development of their employees. We do this by providing the tools and services that help the employees to prioritize, plan and take action on their development.

We’re now the top-rated tool in the 360° Feedback market, used in 134+ countries by thousands of organizations (inc. 3M, Autodesk, Britvic, DDB, Fitness First, Médecins Sans Frontières, and Pandora) to nurture and develop their employees.

We're looking for talented developers to help us make those companies even more successful. You’ll be helping us to deliver even better user-experiences, frequently requested features (like supporting multiple languages), and cutting-edge personal development tools.

If you’re a talented software developer who would love to quickly grow your skills by working with the co-founders of a small SaaS business, and in doing so help real customers to achieve their goals, then read on...


Joining Spidergap

At Spidergap, we're fueled by the passion and exceptional talent of a successful start-up. We're hungry to amaze our customers and grow the business. But we're also focused on the quality-of-life of our team, and as a profitable company (without outside investment!) we're able to support a very healthy work-life balance.

We're looking for like-minded people. People who are passionate about what they do. People who deliver outstanding solutions, and who can do so with a keen understanding of what customers need and the business impact. People who believe in more than work, and are excited by the opportunity to balance work with their families and other hobbies.

Though we've had 5 years of in-house development, you'll be one of the first to help us grow our development team. You'll work closely with the co-founders, developing features from design through to release.

A large part of the work will be developing back-end services with NodeJS and web interfaces with React. You’ll also be exposed to previous technologies we’ve used such as PHP/Yii and Angular. We use agile processes and continuous integration tools to efficiently take features from concept to roll-out, and to continuously optimize our processes.

Your attention to detail will help us to amaze our customers, and to grow our services and codebase in a robust and maintainable way.


Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate to deliver solutions from design to release
  • Work directly with the co-founders, proactively contributing to designs with feedback and ideas for improvement
  • Write reliable, modular, well-tested and "clean" code
  • Support other team members through peer review
  • Help to optimize our development processes and build tools
  • Ensure progress, issues and ideas are communicated clearly to the right people
  • Help us to deliver outstanding customer support.


What we're looking for:

  • Experienced with JavaScript, SQL, HTML, CSS
  • Passionate and driven - about software development, and about life outside work
  • Happy to work remotely
  • Based in a timezone that overlaps the working hours of team members in Sweden and India for at least a few hours each day — unfortunately, we won’t be able to hire in North or South America on this occasion, sorry!
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Loves 'going the extra mile' to deliver outstanding work
  • Believes in and practices self-improvement / personal development
  • Keen and able to learn
  • Loves technology and figuring out how things work and helping others to do the same
  • Communicates clearly, in a friendly way
  • Bonus:
    • Experience with automated testing, ES6, NodeJS, React, Git, automated build tools, PHP, Angular
    • Experienced in using a Mac for software development
    • Experience of working with people in HR / L&D / Talent development


Benefits:

  • Work remotely. As long as your internet connection is excellent and you’re able to collaborate when needed, you’re free to work from any location you wish
  • Flexible working. You’ll need some set hours in which to collaborate with the team, but we’ll do our best to be flexible so you can support your family and hobbies!
  • Annual meet-up - somewhere fun
  • 40 days paid vacation inclusive of public holidays
  • 4 months paid maternity/paternity leave
  • Gym membership contribution 
  • Bring your own device contribution
  • Profit-share bonus
  • Pension contribution
Apply now

Benefits

  • Be part of a ambitious high-growth team
  • Work directly with super-talented co-founders
  • Work remotely
  • Family-friendly, working for co-founders with young families
  • Work flexible hours
  • Always profitable (join an ambitious small company without the risk)
  • Use the latest and greatest tools and technologies
  • Annual meet-up - somewhere fun!
  • Generous holiday allowance
  • Profit-share bonus

items.content:
Node.js Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Company: RoosterMoney | London, UK

Remote details

Office Location: London, UK. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

javascript
typescript
express.js
node.js

Job description

ABOUT ROOSTERMONEY

RoosterMoney is a pocket money & allowance tracking app that helps parents teach their kids the value of money in a digital age. Simple, progressive and gameful, we bring to life all the sound traditional financial principles we were brought up with (or wish we were!) and make managing money smart, fun & relevant for the modern world.

We believe the world would be a better place if we all talked about money a little earlier on in life. Research shows that our money habits are formed by the age of seven. That’s a pretty amazing opportunity to help give kids a head-start in building habits that will stick with them for life.


WHY ROOSTERMONEY?

Hundreds of thousands of families have downloaded the RoosterMoney app since our launch in January 2016 and we have over 51 currencies being used by children around the world. RoosterMoney has been featured in The Times, Telegraph, Guardian, Wall Street Journal, New Zealand Herald to name a few. We’ve been on CNBC and are considered experts in our field.

We are now expanding across a number of markets and looking for a talented and motivated node.js developer to join our team to help us raise our game and achieve even more amazing things. We have a generous share option scheme as we believe that everyone within the company should share in the success they help build.


THE ROLE:

We're looking for a Node JS developer who has held mid-senior positions on engineering teams. They will operate with a high level of autonomy, ensuring impeccable reliability and care deeply about building applications with well thought out architecture.

Working across the RoosterMoney platform as a whole within our small but growing product team (currently 8), the successful candidate will be building something that is used by families around the world. This is the perfect role for someone who enjoys building solutions that are both highly scalable and focused on user experience. The right candidate is someone who takes pride in shipping quality code that is easy to test, maintain and build on.

We are a small team so it’s important that the successful candidate isn’t just technically highly competent but is a good cultural fit.

APPLY IF YOU WANT TO:

  • Work closely with a small group of determined, like-minded people to reshape the way families talk and engage with money around the world.
  • Play a critical role in the development of our platform.
  • Take ownership of impactful new functionality.
  • Develop robust deployment and testing processes.
  • Share your knowledge and passion with the rest of the team in making the platform best in class.

Benefits


In addition to a competitive Salary:

  • Work with a fun, passionate team building something awesome
  • 25 days holiday
  • Pension Scheme
  • Employee Option Scheme
  • Remote working considered as long as you can spend 20% of your time in the office (e.g a few days a month).
Apply now

About RoosterMoney

RoosterMoney takes children from their first steps in understanding the value of money to their first bank account. We bring to life all the sound traditional financial principles we were brought up with (or wish we were!) and make managing money smart, fun & relevant for the modern world.

items.content:
Back-End Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: IT Security, PaaS
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Keyp | München, Germany

Remote details

Office Location: München, Germany. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

sdk
security
identity
claims-based-identity
authentication

Job description

You are going to build the foundation for every citizens' digital identity

Keyps’ mission is to solve the problem that is as old as the internet itself.

Digitalization means the physical and digital worlds are merging, services, communication and processes become data. Our economy is unstoppably transforming into a digital one, and yet, one elementary questions remains unaddressed: "How do we know who is who?" Take for instance contracts, signed by two or more parties: The blockchain promises a solution to protecting and enacting the content, but how do we assert the identity of the parties?

You are at the heart of Keyp’s engineering process building on of the SDKs of Keyp.

We are looking for two Back-End Developers. One with focus on IAM to design our connector SDK. And one with focus on Security to design our development SDK.

What is your role?

  • You are designing and implementing either the connector SDK for different IAM solutions and the protocols in use or the development SDK for external/authentication developers
  • For the connector SDK, you meet on behalf of Keyp with the developers of our business partners to understand their processes and build solutions together with them that meet their needs
  • Your focus is the integration on the client’s side of Keyp
  • For the development SDK you build and implement security related modules in collaboration with security experts
  • Here your focus is on helping developers of authentication solutions with tools so they can connect their solution to Keyp

What are your responsibilities?

  • You make infrastructural decisions such as programming languages to be used in back-end components and provide general support to team members
  • For the IAM focus you build installers that system admins can use to make their IAM system ready for an integration with Keyp
  • Your objective is to integrate Keyp into existing services
  • For the Security focus you design and develop concepts together with our CTO and external security experts to secure Keyps’ protocol while making it easy to use for authentication partners
  • There your objective is to integrate existing solutions to Keyp

Your qualifications

  • You have a very good knowledge is in at least one of NodeJS, PHP, Java, Ruby, Python
  • Regarding the development of the connector SDK you provide a deep understanding of SAML, OAuth, OpenID Connect
  • Also you're experienced in the corporate environment, their IAM services (ADDS, LDAP) and the used standards there
  • Reffering to the development SDD you're experienced in the setup of nginx/apache proxy server, expressJS, Parse server, Tomcat
  • Too you're sympathised with the Open Source environment and motivation to make life easier for other developers

Job location will be Munich, Germany - London, UK - Zurich, Switzerland or the possibility to work remotely.

You can also find a FAQ and if you've come this far you might also be interested in our motivation and where we come from with our ide on keyp.io/jobs.

You want to get in touch with Keyp? We're happy to answer your questions and/or receive your resume.

Apply now

About Keyp

Digitalization means the physical and digital worlds are merging, services, communication and processes become data. Our economy is unstoppably transforming into a digital one, and yet, one elementary questions remains unaddressed: "How do we know who is who?" Take for instance contracts, signed by two or more parties: The blockchain promises a solution to protecting and enacting the content, but how do we assert the identity of the parties?

What you build has no single point of failure and no central data base that could fall victim to attacks, without restricting on usability. But what Keyp collectively - with you - offers is more than just a product: Together with you we’re trying to achieve a kind of “digital enlightenment” regarding security and privacy.

Benefits

  • Flexible environment (work remotely)
  • Complete flexible schedules
  • Equity sharing (Own part of the company and have a real part in Keyp)
  • Taking over hardware costs & mobile contracts
  • Personal development budget (whatever interests you: it's your budget)
  • Complete open holiday policy
  • Holiday contribution for the whole family
  • Taking over kids care costs & paid parent time
  • Regular team events (cabin in the mountains, day trips,...)
  • You can select new benefits-you know best what helps you to unwind ;-)

items.content:
Senior Developer, WordPress Lead

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Mobile Developer
Industry: Digital Agency, Digital Marketing, Product Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Sanborn | New York, NY

Remote details

Office Location: New York, NY. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

nodejs
php
wordpress
laravel
react

Job description

The No-Bullshit-iest Way We Can Describe This Job In The Least Amount Of Words In A Run-On Sentence:

We build a lot of different kinds of stuff for a lot of different kinds of folks (https://sanbornagency.com/work/) at a shop that is big enough to bite off important, meaningful work and small enough to have fun doing it and we’re looking for an engineer who is equally at ease talking to clients, designers, producers, and developers about things like scope, resource allocation, solutions to engineering problems, creative ideas for how to build things, ways to articulate technical complexity to normal business humans...and occasionally...cut some code.

Here’s What We Think You Probably Need to Be Successful At This Job:

  • Have agency experience, leading a development team spread across multiple projects and clients.
  • Hands on developer and leader
  • Are comfortable reviewing project specifications, collaborating with company leadership to develop project estimates and technical specs
  • Experienced in code reviews to adhere to best practices and internal standards, providing feedback and following up on remediation
  • You have an ear to the ground for new tech, whether it comes from hacker news or a programming subreddit, and a desire to dive in and try it out.
  • Experience in architecting and building bespoke custom WordPress themes using Advanced Custom Fields, Gravity Forms, Yoast with custom integrations to third party systems.
  • Experience in client and server-side debugging, performance profiling and optimization techniques with an uncanny intuition for finding the cause and solution
  • Experience with integration of analytics, a/b testing, and advertising platforms using Google Tag Manager
  • Planning out projects in coordination with Project Manager/Producer and Developer team members, participating in project check-ins providing feedback to the team
  • Jumping in to assist developers who are in need of aid in implementation and/or troubleshooting of backend or frontend development goals
  • Aiding and/or leading bug triage in coordination with Project Manager throughout project and during QA
  • Comfortable working with small projects (1 dev) and medium projects (2-3 devs)
  • Experienced in concepting high-level architectures and codifying them in visual and written documentation
  • Experienced with CI / CD build automation tools such as DeployBot, Jenkins, and Travis CI
  • Comfortable in architecting and implementation of APIs in PHP/Laravel, NodeJS/Express and other similar stacks.
  • Attention to detail and a seamless user experience.  This means making the product look like the design and working with your team to make it smooth and perfect.
  • You have real-world experience with React.  AngularJS knowledge might be transferable, but React is what we're looking for.
  • jQuery is "nice to have" but NOT necessary in your arsenal.  You respect the finer points of the browser rendering pipeline and know when to 3D transform (and when NOT to).  Oh, and calls to GetComputedStyle make you shudder, especially when jQuery is obfuscating them.
  • You do so much Wordpress that you have strongly-held opinions about its future, its architecture, and the "right ways" to build with WP.  We keep our stack lean and don't go plugin-heavy.
  • You have strong opinions on, and respect for, the design process.
  • We mostly do a lot of HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL and JavaScript -- we keep it lean and get the job done.
  • You know your way around configuring a local development environment with help from the Interwebz, of course.
  • You know what DevOps is but aren't necessarily a zealot for any one process, technology, or denomination.
  • You have a willingness to express yourself through animated gifs and obscure movie quotes from the youtubes.
  • You work well at the 11th hour, but even better at the first and second so we can be out by happy hour.
  • You're down with remote work. We've got offices in NY / LA but we encourage working from home, from coffee shops, from wherever you feel most comfortable. We've got tools in place to keep communication going online and we love that we can all be in different parts of the country and work together.
  • We constantly improve only because we don't bullshit each other or our clients. We don't hide; we don't say what we think others want to hear. We do our work with respect, and we value truth, transparency, and honesty above all else.

To Apply: 

If you are interested, please apply with a resume and introduction. 

Please feel free to skip the formality of a cover letter and write to me as a human being.  If you need to use a four letter word to effectively express a previous engagement or an appropriately inappropriate metaphor to describe your ideal work environment, I’ll take that over what you would think I typically “need to hear” in a job application. Be yourself. The truth is the easiest thing to remember and I don’t have time to weed through cover-letter-speak to find out who you really are and what you want in life. Just tell me.

Apply now

About Sanborn

We're a 25-person interactive shop working with all manner of organizations (sports teams, beauty brands, magazines, non-profits, pharmaceutical companies, startups) helping to create and manage the full battery of digital media goodness (web, mobile, content, video and experiential activations to be specific).

We believe passionate, talented people all working together smoothly yields awesome work that lets us come back and do it again tomorrow. 

Some more about where we stand as a company: https://sanbornagency.com/about

About Our Engineering Team: 

  • The team is made of folks who seem to enjoy bouncing in and out of different projects of different sizes with varying engineering challenges associated with them. 

  • Our designers are highly technical and our engineers are very invested in the visual fidelity of their work - so some of the lines that typically divide UI/UX and engineering cultures don't really exist here. 

  • At any one given time we'll have folks on longer term missions (ie - 6 to 8 month long-term projects where we're in more of a product development posture) and people on shorter term campaign-based work where we're trying to explode a firecracker in the sky, measure how far and bright it travels, and then move onto to the next one. 

  • We try to keep plates of work varied and diversified.  

  • Everyone is a grownup. 

Benefits

  • Remote work friendly environment.
  • Full health benefits package.
  • Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Los Angeles office locations.
  • Shithead eco-flush system ensuring shitheadless working environment.
  • Family owned and operated.

items.title: Senior 3D Engineer at Envelope (New York, NY)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=17, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Senior 3D Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: 3D Models, Commercial Real Estate, Information Technology
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Envelope | New York, NY

Remote details

Office Location: New York, NY. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

sql
javascript
node.js
three.js
csg

Job description

Join a growing team of engineers working on programmatic 3D geometry and GIS applications in the commercial real estate market.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Interacting closely with content experts to develop nuanced algorithms for the visualization of 3D urban landscapes
  • Working with large geospatial datasets to produce real-time results for a web-based service
  • Collaborating with a distributed team of designers and engineers using tools and infrastructure like Git, Docker, Kubernetes, CI, etc.

Who you are:

  • Expert at server- and client-side JavaScript, SQL, three.js, CSG, and other geometric libraries
  • Experienced at evaluating and manipulating 2D and 3D data in the form of meshes and discrete geometric features
  • Have previous experience creating and consuming RESTful APIs and understand their practical purpose

Nice to have:

  • Experience with GIS data formats and spatial data modeling (GeoJSON, etc.)
  • Knowledge of 2D tile-based mapping libraries like Leaflet and Mapbox.

Both onsite and remote considered.

Apply now

About Envelope

Envelope is a software company, spun out of a longtime collaboration between award-winning SHoP Architects, and the Director of MIT’s Civic Data Design Lab.  Our 3D urban mapping platform integrates proprietary geospatial datasets and sophisticated algorithms to help real estate professionals visualize opportunity and make faster, smarter, and more discreet investment decisions. 

We’re building a cutting-edge 3D spatial analysis and visualization platform, and building it well.  We care about design -- our roots are in architecture, after all.  We care about clean, high-quality code.  We’re diligent about documentation.  We are dedicated to a rapid build-test-ship-repeat development model.  We enjoy spending time with smart people solving tough problems.  We don’t mind when our team works remotely as-needed, because we’re self-motivated enough to get the job done wherever we are. 

We are lucky to be housed in the beautiful Woolworth Building near the foot of the Brooklyn Bridge.  We have hand-ground coffee, gorgeous views of the City from our huge windows, and plenty of room to grow.  We go on frequent excursions into the city to see the real-world effects of the zoning code, and get to know each other outside the office. 

Our small team is passionate about what we do, eager to tackle serious challenges, and growing quickly.  We offer fully-paid individual health care, unlimited vacation days, periodic all-team dinners with curated wines from our vintner co-founder, pre-tax transit, and a range of additional benefits.  Salary and equity are commensurate with experience.

Benefits

  • unlimited vacation days
  • hand-ground coffee
  • double screens
  • full health coverage
  • easy access to all subways
  • beautiful offices in the heart of Manhattan
  • kind, smart, motivated colleagues
  • pre-tax transit benefit

items.content:
Full Stack Senior Web Developer, Small Company - Disruptive Product

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Broadcast, Digital Media, Publishing
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: nxtedition | Malmö, Sweden

Remote details

Office Location: Malmö, Sweden. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

javascript
reactjs
node.js
css
mobx

Job description

nxtedition is looking for its next genuine, passionate and highly skilled Full Stack Senior Web Developer.

  • Someone as excited about developing disruptive software as we are.
  • Wants to be apart of a team of creative, thoughtful people who are enthusiastic about creating bleeding edge results.
  • Who thrive in a fast moving startup environment and who enjoys having big and important responsibilities.

If this sounds like you, let’s talk. We are thrilled to meet you.

As a Senior Full Stack Web Developer you will

  • Design, code, document in Javascript, HTML, CSS.
  • Develop innovative user experiences and work with exciting technologies like React.js and MobX.
  • Demonstrate a mastery of object-oriented as well as functional design practices and patterns.
  • Show leadership through mentoring and assisting junior developers and non-technical staff members.
  • Take ownership of several aspects of or software nxtedition - architecture, quality, user experience.
  • Collaborate with other talented engineers, designers, product managers and more.

You contribute by having

  • Track record of building and maintaining large scale software products.
  • Demonstrated ability to proactively manage many tasks, projects and issues.
  • Mastery of  frameworks and platforms such as React.js, Node.js.
  • Commitment and interest in “the latest” in web development.
  • Experience with modern HTTP frameworks and NoSQL databases.

Nice to have’s

Experience in:

  • Open Source projects.
  • Development of back-end microservices, servers and third-party powering the nxtedition’s platform.
  • Docker, Deepstream, CouchDB, ElasticSearch, Firebase, Webpack, Typescript, Kibana.
  • Broadcast industry.

You’ll be joining a very talented team and helping us on our journey over the entire globe. Relocation is available for exceptionally qualified candidate.

Terms

City: Malmö- Sweden. Relocation is possible for the right candidate

Scope: Full-time

Language: English is a requirement, however, Swedish is not

Start: Immediately or as soon as possible

Selection: Selection is ongoing

Contact: application@nxtedition.com

Apply now

About nxtedition

nxtedition is a software company with a vision to change and disrupt the paradigm of complex workflows within the broadcast media industry.

We solve that by taking care of the entire workflow using smart and modern Web technologies presented in one intuitive user interface.

We’re searching for self-motivated, energetic individuals to join our team in moving nxtedition’s vision towards the ultimate solution for the media industry.

Our head office is in Malmö and all our developers have the possibility

of working remotely.

You would should have a good understanding of our development tools which include React.js, Node.js, Deepstream and MobX.

Candidates should have creative ideas, problem solving skills and the ability to

work and thrive within a fast-paced environment. Mastering existing and new web

technologies as well as using well designed efficient code is key to success in this position.

Talented developers joining our core development team can expect to tackle the

challenges of live television, post-production and social media with imaginative and

disruptive solutions.

nxtedition can offer competitive benefits, and a pleasant working environment amongst

a highly skilled development team and the opportunity to work within the fast moving

world of broadcast television.

Benefits

  • Flexible hours
  • Company car
  • Fun & creative atmosphere
  • Paid vacation and holidays
  • Large and impressive technology stack
  • Working with the latest web technologies
  • Own choice of hardware/development kit
  • Possibility to work remotely
  • Highly skilled colleagues
  • Subsidised gym and health center

Front End Javascript Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

javascript
reactjs
agile
node.js
css

Job description

## DESCRIPTION
Clevertech is looking for a Front End Javascript Engineer to join our global team. In this role you will have significant front end responsibility in one of our project development teams to ensure client satisfaction by using modern design patterns, and cutting edge development thinking including isomorphic code, stateless components, and functional concepts.

Well qualified applicants will have deep experience in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You will have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities by their success and technical depth. You might also have a chance to use React Native, Electron, and Ionic.


---

## REQUIREMENTS


* 3+ years professional experience working with NodeJS
* Strong domain knowledge on web fundamentals like HTML, JavaScript, and CSS
* Comfortable in a test-driven development environment
* Self-motivated, proactive and take ownership of issues
* Thrive and excel in our diverse, distributed and agile team environment
* Knowledge about the Lean Startup and Agile Methodologies
* Strong communicator at a standard of native-speaker in English

Apply now

About Clevertech

BENEFITS Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source

items.content:
FullStack Developer (Must be EU based)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Entertainment, Media, Online Media
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Kodify | No office location

Technologies

reactjs
javascript
mongodb
node.js

Job description

The team at Kodify is looking for a talented FullStack Developer to join our remote team. This specific role is open to remote candidates based in European Union only (a must for us). With you on board, we’re looking to expand our team (currently 10 developers working across multiple European locations) and take our projects to a whole new level. You will deliver Javascript development skills on the front and backend systems that power our sites. Good knowledge of HTML and CSS are also required, along with the ability to work with our designers and the business to implement the features required.

Your key responsibilities: 

  • Create Server and Client JS, HTML & CSS to deliver required functionality and design
  • Ensure all code is modular, and where possible developed as reusable
  • End-to-end responsibility from technical design to deployment and testing
  • Work with Designers & Product Owners to ensure they understand possibilities/limitations
  • Always work towards minimizing page load time & data transferred
  • Become a valued team member, providing feedback to the team
  • Take ownership of your code / tasks / role
  • Be proud of what you achieve, and of the product, and be one of the driving forces behind always making it better
  • When you cock-up - own-up! (We don’t do blame-storming here!)
  • Have fun and enjoy your job!

About you:

  • You’re a real team player. You love to help and find solutions together.
  • Your sense of humour will bring a new dynamic to the team - you love to have fun while you work!
  • You can think on your feet and adapt well to fast-changing environments and priorities.
  • You are passionate about software development
  • You're able to think beyond code to architecture and user experience
  • You have a real ‘Can Do’ work ethic - We are results based, not clock based!

Skills & Requirements

Must Have:

  • NodeJS
  • Javascript / HTML / CSS
  • MongoDB
  • Github
  • LESS / SASS
  • Bootstrap and JQuery

Bonus points:

  • React
  • Express / Connect
  • Redis
  • RequireJS
  • ZeroMQ
  • TDD
  • BusterJS / CucumberJS with WebdriverIO
  • Your own open source projects
  • DataTables
  • High traffic websites
  • Linux
  • AWS Technologies (e.g. EC2, S3, Cloudformation, ..)
  • Chef
  • Streaming video technologies / Web playback tools (VideoJS)
  • Understanding of, and agreement with, Agile principles
  • Knowledge and experience in Git and JIRA

Other:

  • Experience working remotely and with remote teams
  • Experience managing high traffic and content heavy websites.

Education is compulsory, but where you got it is irrelevant for us! We are looking for someone who has worked in a similar role (or roles) for at least 3 years and can show us examples of their work. We are not looking for a newbie, nor are we looking for a rock star, we are looking for a mid to senior level developer who wants to both learn and contribute to our team.

Do you like what you read and want to be part of it? Please send us your CV along with a covering letter explaining why this job is right for you, and why you are right for the job!

Apply now

About Kodify

Kodify just passed its 5th year anniversary but we're based on years of success, building and managing high-traffic websites. We have grown our websites to 6M visitors per day which comes with a challenging set of technical problems to overcome. Our success is down to Kodify’s teamwork, where each one of us plays a key role in getting us one step closer to our goals. All of this doesn’t happen without a healthy portion of fun & perks! From company BBQs on our fantastic terrace, to yearly company off-sites, we make sure sure to live by our motto “Work Hard, Play Harder” and balance it all out! It’s our goal to create one of the best working environments possible which allows everyone to grow and achieve their maximum potential with their individual skill sets.

What’s on offer:

  • Core hours with flexitime: work when you’re at your most creative!
  • Training and development budget and free days to attend training/conferences/etc.
  • Latest tech equipment: choose whatever boosts your productivity!
  • Agile environment
  • 10% time for personal projects
  • Free afternoons on Fridays
  • Company Amazon book account
  • Half Day off on your Birthday
  • Awesome offices and locations: Barcelona, Altea and Montreal!
  • Kodify off-sites, events and team activities!
  • Unique Kodify culture!

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • 10% time for personal projects
  • Private health insurance
  • Core hours with Flexitime
  • Brand new equipment on joining
  • Learning and development budget
  • Free lunches
  • Yearly 3 day company off-sites
  • Free snacks, drinks and lots of team activities!
  • Amazing offices in: Barcelona, LA, Altea and Montreal!

items.title: JavaScript Developer with Dev Ops Experience
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=6, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=6}
items.content:
JavaScript Developer with Dev Ops Experience

Company: Bitovi

ABOUT BITOVI:

Bitovi helps companies create better web applications.  

We have a track record of designing and building high-profile and amazing web applications through our active Consulting practice.  Our apps are built with tests, full docs and a deployment process in place.

Bitovi has been a pioneer in producing advanced JavaScript frameworks and tools for almost a decade. We develop and maintain several open source products such as CanJS, DoneJS, and StealJS to name a few.  We are interested in product innovation and opportunities.

Our team is comprised of about 30ish developers and designers located around the US and Canada. This is a remote, full-time position.  Due to travel requirements, at this time we are seeking candidates in the US who are willing and able to travel.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We are looking for qualified individuals with:
  • a good understanding of Computer Science
  • a solid background in Modern Front End Development, including JavaScript frameworks
  • professional experience developing enterprise applications
  • CS degree or equivalent knowledge
  • Dev Ops experience required - EX: Stackstorm, Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Mesos, Nomad, etc

We welcome diversity and non-traditional paths into the developer profession and advocate strongly for hiring the right person as opposed to the right combination of tech keywords.


THE JOB:

You’ll work with clients creating applications, discussing and designing architectures, reviewing code, and researching new front-end technologies.

You’ll work closely with our Open Source team, helping us to advance, improve, and evolve our Open Source toolset.

You’ll have the opportunity to shape a small and growing company by applying your talent and passion to the JavaScript 
community in your own way.

We support the technical growth and development of our employees. We have an open and engaging community of skilled developers with whom you can collaborate and learn together.

Bitovi developers:
  • Present at conferences
  • Give trainings
  • Plan and run meetups
  • Create and maintain open source projects
  • Write articles


A LITTLE BIT MORE:

We’re looking for passionate JavaScript developers who identify with our mission.

We want someone who enjoys identifying the hard parts of application development and simplifying them, talking about software architecture, and teaching others. We also want someone who can lead others and be an integral part of a team.

Specifically, the following attributes are major positives, but not all hard requirements:
  • Has an eagerness to learn and execute in the “the right way”
  • Is open minded about development best practices
  • Has some experience with back-end systems and databases
  • Doesn’t mind a bit of travel, averaging one week every month
  • Enjoys working on client projects and interacting with clients
  • Some experience contributing to or using open source projects


BENEFITS:

Bitovians get a slate of great benefits. Bitovi offers:
  • Competitive salary and yearly bonuses
  • Bi-annual company retreats to places like Las Vegas, New Orleans, and Denver
  • 401(k) plan with matching
  • 4 weeks of paid vacation
  • Health and dental insurance
  • LTD and Life Insurance
  • Gym membership reimbursement
  • Maternity & Paternity leave
  • Working from home with flexible hours


How to apply:
Please use this link to apply: bitovi.applytojob.com/apply/OLRHThmnsc/JavaScript-Developer-Dev-Ops-Exp Share your resume and a thoughtful cover letter that shows us that you’re the kind of person we’ve described above. Share something you've built or worked on and let us know what you are most proud of related to it. *Please note that we are not interested in working with Recruiters or Hiring firms at this time.

items.content:
Senior Android Engineer

Company: G2i inc

We’re looking for talented Android engineers to partner with amazing product companies to work as part of a team on Android apps. We regularly partner with Y Combinator funded product companies that place a high value on engineering. Strong communication and documentation skills are needed as this is a fast paced engineering environment. At least 3 years of mobile development experience is required and full stack experience with Rails or Node.js is a plus (Apollo Client/GraphQL experience a huge plus). While we prefer candidates that have experience in React Native, it isn’t required.

Contract lengths vary depending on the project, but range from 1 to 3 months (some last as long as 6 months). We also have contract to hire roles available, where after a short contract the company hires you full time remotely. The majority of our clients are in the San Francisco area so the closer to that timezone the better. You must be living in North America, South America or Europe.

Remote Position, but you must be living in:

  • North America
  • Central/South America
  • Europe

Requirements:

  • Fluent with both verbal and written English
  • Java code samples you can share
  • A sample of documentation you have written
  • 30-40 hours per week of availability
  • Mid-Senior or Senior level Position (3+ years of professional experience)

Nice to have's:

  • React Native experience
  • Kotlin Experience
  • Full stack experience with Rails or Node.js
  • GraphQL experience
How to apply:
Please apply using this link: jobs.lever.co/g2i/efb3903f-29ae-48a0-aea2-9c1535fb4164/apply

items.content:
Full Stack Engineer

Company: Knock
Seattle, WA, US

Join a fast-growing company, and help us change an antiquated industry with an awesome team! We want to hear from you!

We are looking for a solid engineer and problem solver who can help us build products that are going to change the home and apartment rental industry. Knock has great traction, strong revenue growth (12%+ mo/mo past year), excited customers (much of our funding came from customers), and an ambitious product roadmap.

Projects you may work on:

  • Public API, to extend our chat, messaging, and scheduling platform to any (every) developer who wants to integrate
  • Real-time analytics platform thats helps our customers make decisions and improve their leasing performance
  • Chatbots that work across SMS, Voice, and In-app
  • Automation of advertising and social media publishing
  • Machine learning and recommendation engines
  • Your ideas!

Skills & Requirements

Requirements:

  • Ability to work across the stack
  • Shipped something at a start-up, or on your own
  • Fast learner, can adapt to new tools/languages
  • Team player that can ask good questions and collaborate
  • Innate curiosity and drive to build great stuff!
  • We prefer local candidates, but will consider remote candidates as well

Our stack:

  • Backend Python and Node.js
  • Frontend is mostly React, one app in Angular
  • DB: Postgresql Redis and ElasticSearch, hosted on AWS

Compensation / benefits:

  • Competitive base salary
  • Equity for all employees
  • Medical insurance plan (company paid)
  • Dental insurance plan (company paid)
  • Vision insurance plan (company paid)

Full stack web developer at Bulb Software

London, Remote · Full Time

We believe that within the next 5 years most businesses will be connected (and sooner than our homes!). So we're on a mission to help them manage their (physical) assets in a smart way, using apps and IoT technologies, to operate more efficiently and achieve significant cost savings.
We're currently hosted by the Greenwich Digital Innovation Centre (www.digitalgreenwich.com) an exciting Smart City initiative.

Applied
Apply to Bulb Software
Add a message to Bulb Software
Apply

Job Description

We're looking for experienced full stack developers that love crafting beautiful web apps and smart applications. If you're at this stage of your career where you're looking for a position where you can contribute directly to product development and really make a difference in the business (and be rewarded for it) we should talk!

***MUST HAVES***

Your background:
- You have a Bsc/MsC in computer Science, mathematics or any other degree or experience that demonstrates highly analytical skills
- You've got a successful experience working for a startup
- You've helped your team build a great B2B/SaaS (rather complex) product and can demonstrate your direct contribution in achieving this

Your skills:
- 3+ years experience working with our technology stack (e.g. html5/CSS3, Angular JS, React JS, Node JS)
- You can demonstrate ability to quickly understand customer/business problems and you're pretty creative at finding solutions to solve them.
- You own your features from A to Z and can ship the features expected with clean code, quickly.
- You have a strong UX/UI focus but can dive into backend when required (Node JS and postgreSQL required)
- You're comfortable with customer facing interactions

Personality traits we’ll be looking for:
- You've got tons of curiosity
- You learn insanely fast and adapt to change easily
- You've demonstrated grit, tenacity to achieve challenging goals (personal and/or at work)
- High EQ: you communicate well and can get along with all our team members (rather they're in product or growth parts of the business)
- You have strong work ethic and are autonomous

***NICE TO HAVES***
- You speak another foreign language (e.g. French, German, Spanish, Italian)
- Experience with finance/accounting, fleet/asset management software

***SALARY/COMPENSATION***
We believe a small team of rock stars can accomplish at least 10x more than an average team so we recruit very selectively and for the right candidate our salary/compensation package can be pretty competitive. We also offer flexible/remote working conditions however team get-togethers are required from time to time, especially during your onboarding (expect somewhere fun in South Europe, but that's a surprise!), so you need to be opened to travel.

Skills
Node.js, PostgreSQL, Angular.JS, React.js, Front-End/Full-Stack (UI-AngularJS-JS-NodeJS)
Compensation
€55K–€80K
0.5%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

What We're Building

Here's the thing, companies finance many physical assets that cost them money if they don't track them. The problem is, above a certain volume (typically more than 50 assets) trying to do this with excel spreadsheets and paperwork becomes a nightmare!

Our NextGen asset management web app helps customers with 3 main things:
1- Consolidate all data about their assets in one place and keep history (e.g. events, costs, location)
2- Automate many administrative tasks (e.g. order, delivery, allocation to users or organisation, damages, returns/exits) and work more efficiently
3- Get smart data (KPIs, dashboards, real-time notification and alerts) based on our analysis of all the data we collect from many sources (e.g. users, suppliers) including data from assets' sensors using IoT

Indeed, we believe that in the next few years IoT and asset sensors will generate a large volume of data that will enable us to provide real-time meaningful info to our customers.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer/Technical + Team Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=12, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Generalist with can-do attitude required to join an exciting early stage startup building wearable technology to disrupt the events space.

Do you like integrating technologies that link the world together? Do you dream about real-world experience building large-scale applications connecting people and devices together using a variety of technologies? Are you motivated by working in a fast-paced dynamic environment?

We’re looking for a UK-based very hands-on Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead to join and help manage our 100% remote team and evolve our product.

Role Requirements

  • Good fundamental Computer Science knowledge (graph theory, matrix operations, etc)
  • Comfortable wearing Research, Development, and Operations hats in parallel
  • Architecting and building modern scalable mobile, front and back end environments
  • Familiarity with operational concerns (engineering-for-failure, scalability, performance)
  • Building systems in a mix of languages
  • Operating almost 100% remotely
  • Working with a 100% remote team across a variety of cultures and timezones
  • Excellent written and oral skills in both technical and colloquial English

Desired Technical Skills

  • Experience of using Bluetooth / BLE networking technologies (e.g. iBeacon, Eddystone, etc)
  • Experience using hosted systems like AWS and Heroku
  • Good Python ability (e.g. Jupyter, Numpy, Pandas) for basic matrix operations and data analysis
  • Good understanding of data analytics, methods, and tooling for real-time report generation
  • Good Node.js ability (e.g. building APIs)
  • Document oriented databases (ideally Mongo)
  • Understanding how to package an embedded mobile SDK and the support ecosystem that goes with it

Optional Technical Skills

  • Good understanding of mobile application development & deployment systems
  • Real-world understanding of modern message passing architectures and brokers (AMQP)
  • Orchestration & deployment of production / development environments to multiple cloud platforms
  • Cybersecurity, privacy and compliance, and infrastructure resiliency

Distinct Advantages

  • Experience with Machine Learning techniques
  • Knowledge of Graph Database technologies
  • Experience successfully working with remote teams

Culture and Personality

  • Commitment to others within a cohesive team
  • Solution-focused, consultative and comfortable working in a fluid environment
  • Curious and eager to pick up new technologies and languages quickly
  • Enjoys solving complex problems through creative thinking
  • Very comfortable working in a flexible, output-driven culture
  • Self-directed, nimble and proactive - constantly connecting dots and thinking of the next step
  • Thrives in a diverse, dynamic, and collaborative team
  • Able and willing to challenge thinking across all levels of the business
  • Loves to document

About Hiver

Hiver is a London-based tech startup using wearable technology to help event marketers measure and improve engagement at their events. It also helps event attendees remember every contact they meet and quickly follow-up and further connect. Hiver combines the physical event experience with the digital smart networking technology experience.

Hiver has been featured Forbes, The Financial Times, and Thrive Global; and has also won Best New Event Tech by Exhibition News. If you’re interested in the position, send a note to hello@hivertech.com with your LinkedIn profile/CV with the subject line “Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead”

Learn more about Hiver at www.hivertech.com No agencies, please.

items.title: Front End ReactJS developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=34, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=32}
items.content:
OfficeServe is a disruptor in the corporate catering market. Our products and services currently focus on food delivery services, but we have big plans to diversify and expand our offering in the b2b market.

We are a high growth, well-funded start-up business enabling our business customers to order food online through on-demand ordering. Our amazing head office is located at the heart of London’s Silicon Roundabout, 2mins walk from Old Street Station or 10mins walk from Shoreditch High street. The office includes a spacious lounge, roof garden, kitchen & dining areas, an on-site Cafe and gym (with regular fitness and yoga classes), bike storage, showers and screening room! The office also regularly hosts various technology meetups and events.

We have built our products using the latest technologies to create fast, scalable and accessible products that work on any device and deliver fantastic consumer experiences.

Our customer web portal is built using isomorphic React with a Node.js/KOA APIs on an AWS stack. We are looking for someone to take over and lead the front end (and associated back end elements) from our CTO as this area of the business now requires its own team.

The web portal is a key part of our offering and we expect this role to become more important within the business as we scale. There are plenty of opportunities to put your own stamp on the project.

REQUIREMENTS:

A minimum of two years working with React, Node.js, Javascript, preferably on AWS

Practical experience with:
- ES6
- BitBucket/Jira for issue tracking and code management
- Code testing in Javascript
- Npm, webpack, etc.

Useful to have:
- MySQL
- Amazon EC2 servers

We are looking for someone to start as soon as possible. The interview process will involve:

- A phone call with our CTO to discuss the company, your background and the role
- A tech test (which can be done remotely and will take approx. 1 hour)
- A face-to-face interview (at our Old St office) with our CTO and another member of senior management

This role is for an in-house position working at the Old St office (initially 5 days a week while you get familiar with our platform etc but later we are flexible to dropping this to 4 days in house and 1 day remote).

Now is an exciting time to join this entrepreneurial business with huge ambitions! Since launching in 2016, our business has been hugely successful in growing revenue and customer numbers. This growth has critically depended upon our people, high quality products and services. Most importantly, our success is and will be based on hiring exceptionally talented individuals that understand our customers’ value and need.

We look forward to hearing from you...

Please send a CV and we'll get back to you as soon as we can.

items.content:
A highly flexible developer role where you will be working with the latest technologies and with leading people in your field, with flexibility and opportunity to learn. (Salary depending on experience)

VeryConnect is a rapidly growing business to business software start-up, based in Glasgow, specialising in membership and association management. We offer a range of services customised to the administrative needs of organisations including payment management, campaign marketing and online community features.


We’re a small but highly ambitious international team, who are growing fast. You’ll be working with some of the most talented people in their fields, who are looking to scale. You’ll have opportunities for working from home, flexible hours/holidays and remote working as desired (note: you'll need to be in the EU).

The role will initially involve building a testing framework and suite of tests on our existing codebase. You will play a significant role in the design and architecture of the framework. In parallel, we will be refactoring the backend with the ambition to create an automated deployment process. The role will also involve data migration scripting on an ongoing basis. There is the opportunity for this role to evolve into backend development.


We’re looking for the highly-talented backend developer among you, who loves (or is excited to learn) the latest web technologies (Node.js, Mongodb, Redis, Docker). We’ve got a truly innovative, expertly-coded platform and you’ll be working alongside some great developers (first class compsci degrees, past interns at NASA, PhDs in compsci, etc). Come join us!

items.content:
Senior Android Engineer

Company: G2i inc
Remote

We’re looking for talented Android engineers to partner with amazing product companies to work as part of a team on Android apps. We regularly partner with Y Combinator funded product companies that place a high value on engineering. Strong communication and documentation skills are needed as this is a fast paced engineering environment. At least 3 years of mobile development experience is required and full stack experience with Rails or Node.js is a plus (Apollo Client/GraphQL experience a huge plus). While we prefer candidates that have experience in React Native, it isn’t required.

Contract lengths vary depending on the project, but range from 1 to 3 months (some last as long as 6 months). We also have contract to hire roles available, where after a short contract the company hires you full time remotely. The majority of our clients are in the San Francisco area so the closer to that timezone the better. You must be living in North America, South America or Europe.

Remote Position, but you must be living in:

  • North America
  • Central/South America
  • Europe

Requirements:

  • Fluent with both verbal and written English
  • Java code samples you can share
  • A sample of documentation you have written
  • 30-40 hours per week of availability
  • Mid-Senior or Senior level Position (3+ years of professional experience)

Nice to have's:

  • React Native experience
  • Kotlin Experience
  • Full stack experience with Rails or Node.js
  • GraphQL experience

items.content:
Architect/experienced programmer SDK | Blockchain

Company: Ape Unit
Location: Berlin, Germany
Job type: Full-time
Salary: EUR 45-65
Skills:
  • Agile
  • Blockchain
  • Functional programming
  • Javascript

    • Company description

    We are a tech hub - a multidisciplinary and inclusive network or creators, strategists, developers and designers in Berlin. Our work is filled with curiosity. We like to identify opportunities: working side by side with disruptive blockchain innovators, established owner-managed companies and global corporations. Our mission is to coordinate, create and accelerate change for an exclusive circle of clients, cultivating long term relationships and always aiming for excellence.



    We are a design focused development firm and our reputation is built on our hands-on approach. We keep our promises to each other, our partners, clients and users. We offer our employees a positive working environment that runs like a business but acts like a family. We are supportive and agile, we offer curious and enthusiastic individuals the time and space to research and evaluate trends and technologies in open source software and grow their skill sets. Our structure allows for flexible working hours, new working models, realistic workloads with high value on not treating people like robots, because we respect your personal time! Being part of a diverse team of professionals in a comfortable, friendly office where you are fairly compensated for your efforts offers a high standard of living in beautiful Berlin.

    Job description

    Overview

    We are tasked with developing the SDKs for a new blockchain currently in development. The scope of our work includes the low-level libraries which interface with the blockchain using REST APIs and JSON, and an initial set of dapps to provide early users with the tools they need, and to provide other developers with high-quality example code which they can build on and learn from. Our current lead architect is leaving, and so we’re looking for someone to fill his not inconsiderable shoes.

    The whole of our project is Open Source, so your work will be available to the entire community without restrictions. You will also be able to use it as an example to previous employers of what you are capable of.

    About Us

    We are a tech hub - a multidisciplinary and inclusive network or creators, strategists, developers and designers in Berlin. Our work is filled with curiosity. We like to identify opportunities: working side by side with disruptive blockchain innovators, established owner-managed companies and global corporations.

    We are a diverse team of professionals and the reputation of our design focused development firm has been built upon our hands-on approach. We offer curious and enthusiastic individuals the opportunity to evaluate trends and technologies in open source software and grow their skill sets. We provide our employees a positive working environment that runs like a business but acts like a family. Our realistic workloads, comfortable, friendly office, and fair compensation allows for a high standard of living for our valued team members here in beautiful Berlin.

    About the Work

    Our two deliverables for this project are high-quality SDKs—currently targeting JavaScript and Python, but with more languages in the pipeline—and a set of consumer applications using those libraries. As stated, the goal of the applications is both to give early users of the blockchain a great user experience, and excellent security, and to be a platform to build on, and reference library for other developers and companies coming to our blockchain.

    We use modern, functional paradigms in our code, which makes the task for the SDK team more difficult, but makes writing code which uses it much more easy. So we’re looking for someone at the top of their game, who has kept up to date with the most recent developments in the state of the art of JavaScript development, and who’s looking to keep their skills up-to-date.

    About You

    Our ideal candidate is an experienced programmer and systems architect who is collaborative, self-motivated, who is interested in new challenges and a fast and dedicated learner. We tend to prefer functional programming idioms, which you should be comfortable with. You can push ideas forward in an agile project environment, are comfortable working with a diverse, partly remote team, and are able to see the big picture in any project as well as lead your team to clarity with a solutions-oriented approach. You are a bridge between the technical and visual aspects of the project, and always excited about new possibilities. Oh, and you are a great software developer.

    Skills

    · Excellent skills in modern JavaScript (or willingness/aptitude to learn), Yarn, Node.js, Ramda, Webpack

    · Experience with modern JavaScript features including ES6 modules, async/await and Promises

    · Proficient in GIT and knowledge of pull request based workflows, ideally Git-flow

    · Interest and experienced in API design

    · General understanding of blockchain and decentralized apps and motivated to learn more

    · Excellent communication skills

    Bonus Skills

    · Some experience with Linux servers, and containers (Docker)

    · Experienced in smart contract programming (Solidity)

    · Understanding of cryptography

    · Project Management experience

    · Comfort with test driven development and continuous integration

    Apply now!

items.content:
JavaScript UI Developer


Roostermoney


ABOUT ROOSTERMONEY:
RoosterMoney is a pocket money & allowance tracking app that helps parents teach their kids the value of money in a digital age. Simple, progressive and gameful, we bring to life all the sound traditional financial principles we were brought up with (or wish we were!) and make managing money smart, fun & relevant for the modern world.
We believe the world would be a better place if we all talked about money a little earlier on in life. Research shows that our money habits are formed by the age of seven. Thats a pretty amazing opportunity to help give kids a head-start in building habits that will stick with them for life.


WHY ROOSTERMONEY?RoosterMoney has been featured in The Times, Telegraph, Guardian, FT, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Australian Herald to name a few. Hundreds of thousands of families have downloaded the RoosterMoney app since our launch in January 2016. We are looking for a talented and motivated senior UI developer to join our team to help us achieve even more amazing things. We have a generous share option scheme and youll be joining us as we expand across a number of new territories.


THE ROLE:
We're looking for a software developer who has held mid-senior positions on front-end engineering teams, who will operate with a high level of autonomy.
You will be developing our core RoosterMoney app and working across the platform as a whole within our small but growing product team (currently 8), building an application that is used by families around the world. You have a passion for UX and UI, best practice development and building a product that delights users on a daily basis, taking pride in shipping quality code that is easy to test, maintain and build on. You care deeply about building applications with well thought out architecture.


Aside from developing front-end applications, we expect you will also become involved with ops and back-end work with our Node APIs where required.


We are a small team so its important that the successful candidate isnt just technically highly competent but is a good cultural fit. We run daily stand-ups, two week sprint cycles, retrospectives and utilise Slack for Chat and Jira for ticket and stream management. We use video calls to stay in contact and monthly all team meetings (State of the Rooster). We gather together every quarter for All Hands to celebrate successes, share ideas and plan for the next quarter of hustle.


Apply if you want to:
* Work closely with a small group of determined, like-minded people to reshape the way families talk and engage with money around the world.
* Play a critical role in the design and development of our app.
* Ship and take ownership of impactful new features and functionality.
* Develop robust deployment and testing processes
* Share your knowledge and passion with the rest of the team in making the app best in class.



Benefits

In addition to a competitive salary:

* Work with a fun, passionate team building something awesome.
* 25 days holiday
* Pension Scheme
* Employee Option Scheme so you can benefit for all the input you put into the company.
* We will consider remote working for this role so long as you can spend up to 20% of your time in our London Bridge Hub office. We run a Remote working structure as a team (we currently have team members in London, Bristol and Stoke in the UK and Barcelona, Spain) so time zone variance (and travel distance) has to be sensible.




We can't offer visa sponsorship at this time.

See more jobs at Roostermoney

What We're Building

Wundershine makes it extremely easy to get a feed of fresh pictures and digital art from your smartphone or camera to the walls in your home. Not with glaring screens and power cords, but with a combination of stylish wooden frames and digital prints.

In this mobile age, we create more and better pictures than ever, but they remain trapped in our devices. The walls in our home have always been the prime setting to enjoy personal and decorative content. So why are they still offline? -

Time for a re-imagining.

The Wundershine system consists of wall-mounted picture frames with automated framing mechanism, a mobile app and elegant print storage boxes. Now you can quickly frame fresh pictures on demand. No need to take frames of the wall and mess around with rulers, calculators, paper cutters, metal clips, etc.

It is a complete ecosystem for curating, showcasing and keeping your favourite photos and art.
