items.title: Full Stack Developer ($75k - 150k)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=48, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=22}
items.content:
Full Stack Developer ($75k - 150k)

Company: Christian Care Ministry

Christian Care Ministry’s mission is to connect and equip Christians to share their lives, faith, talents, and resources with others. We primarily do so through Medi-Share, but as an association of churches, we’re rapidly expanding our “ministry portfolio” and we think technology will be at the center of accomplishing that goal. That’s where you come in. We need help creating and supporting applications (mobile + browser) for the future products and projects we’ve got in the proverbial “hopper.”

But before we go any further, you need to know if you’ll like working with us. We think you will.

A bit about us: You already know the mission of Christian Care Ministry (CCM). We have about 580 employees in various states, but most of them are either at our headquarters in Melbourne, FL, or our Colorado Springs, CO branch. Medi-Share has been growing in every way imaginable since about 2010. It has become commonplace for our CFO to say things like “We’ve grown 30% year over year …again” at seemingly every quarterly employee town hall meeting. We’re extremely humbled and grateful to the Lord for the growth.

Christian Care Ministry is a community of Christians that requires its employees to share its Christian religious beliefs and practices. CCM complies with all anti-discrimination laws applicable to religious employers. 

About the role: This position serves on the New Product Engineering Team in a Product Team setting. This small, sub-department of our IT team (which is currently under 10 people) is mostly remote. Their main focus has been making some dreams of the leadership team come true (well, at least the dreams that involve amazing code :). 

Life as an Employee with CCM’s New Product Engineering Team: We work really hard to make working here an amazing experience. It’s hard to find great talent like you, but if you pick us, we want to keep you for a long time. We have a team full of truly exceptional people—the kind you’ll be excited to work with. Here’s how we operate:

Do you prefer mountains or oceans?

While the majority of the NPE Team is distributed, it is our overwhelming preference that you live near our Colorado Springs, CO office or our headquarters in Melbourne, FL.  However, with modern tools, proximity doesn’t influence productivity and if absolutely necessary, we can discuss an exception. For this job in particular, we do need some collaboration though, so just make sure you have a reliable internet connection, of course.

No Crazy Hours

The New Product Engineering Team is operating in “start up” mode. This means that we work hard and smart to get projects completed in a reasonable timeline. On occasion, there may be instances when extra time is needed (usually around a product launch or a really big release), but those are pretty infrequent. Basically, we commit you to at least 6 hours of coding per day in our Sprints and as long as you get the work done, we’re okay with when you get it done. Just be available when the team may need your help, or when you may need their help. Sometimes life happens in the middle of the day, and we understand that. We also think “more meetings” means less time for coding so we protect your time. We have one morning stand-up at 10am EST where we find out when there could be overlap that day. Oh, one more cool thing about the only meeting you attend – we “eat our own dog food” and close each stand-up praying for Medi-Share members’ needs listed in our mobile app.

Up Your Game

We’re serious about helping you improve your craft. We budget for it by giving you those extra 2 hours per workday to collaborate or learn. The stack we generally work on is relatively new so taking time to hone in your skills is pretty imperative. We send members to conferences or webinars as we need to. We love seeing our people growing.

Now, back to you, our new Full Stack Developer…

This is the part where we describe the experience necessary to be considered for the position.

You’re a skilled developer, but maybe you haven’t gotten a chance to prove it yet professionally. We can give you that chance. 

But before you get _too_ excited, let me explain. We only hire great developers, and this position is no exception. When we ask you to write or debug code during our interviews, you’ll do so confidently. You might not be able to show us 5 applications you’ve shipped, but you can point to something recent you’ve spent significant time coding that you’re really proud of, like your university project, your open source contributions, or your project at your last job. If we ask your professors, classmates, or coworkers about you, they’ll have great things to say.

In short, we won’t teach you how to be a good programmer, since you already are, but we can certainly help you be a better, professionally-experienced programmer.

Our ideal candidate either has a college degree in computer science, or if not, 2+ years of recent, solid professional programming experience. Our especially ideal candidate has experience with either Node.js or React.js. Having only done that in your free time is fine. That tells us you are curious enough to learn on your own.

Our stack contains a very healthy JavaScript client utilizing Heroku, Node.js, React.js, and a few others. CCM is in the process of migrating to Salesforce so we often interact with their APIs. For our mobile apps we’re using React Native, because, well, basically, it’s awesome (and we really think our philosophies of “API First” and “Learn Once, Code Everywhere” are going to be the norm in the near future). Our backend API servers use either Ruby on Rails or Node.js/Express, with PostgreSQL and Redis as our data layer. Despite those being our “sweet spots” before we take on a new product, we pick the stack that works best for that solution.

You’re the one we’re looking for if you:

  • Are curious how things work, you are self-motivated and self-driven.
  • Are an excellent developer and can adapt to new languages quickly.
  • Write code that is easy for other programmers to understand and use.
  • Thrive with directions like:
    • “Here is the mock up for feature X. How do you think we should approach this?”
    • "Check out the Jira story and play a bit with library X on GitHub. This might solve our problem Y. Let's discuss the pros and cons tomorrow."  
    • "This component needs to be re-architected to allow for X. How do you think we should do it and why do you think that's a good idea?"
  • Are excited to work across multiple platforms with different technologies.
  • You got a smirk on your face when you saw you could work on the stack listed above, AT A MINISTRY!
  • As you’ve read this job description, you realize this team obviously is comprised of people who you’d enjoy spending a work week with. (ended that sentence with a preposition, we're not paid for our grammatical skills)

Bonus Points

  • You already are a Medi-Share member or would want to join membership even if you didn’t work here.
  • You’ve built stuff using React Native (even if it was for your mom’s bingo club or something crazier).

Next Steps

Super important stuff that sounds like it was written by lawyers:

This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employee(s) will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship.

Christian Care Ministry is committed to serving the Lord and our membership with excellence. As employees we are committed to adhering to the same standard of Biblical principles of lifestyle and health as required for membership in our Medi-Share program which include:

  • Have a verifiable Christian testimony indicating a personal relationship with the Lord Jesus Christ, and profess the Statement of Faith
  • Attend a fellowship of believers, regularly and actively support that ministry, and live under the discipline of that body
  • Share the conviction that believers are to bear one another’s burdens according to Galatians 6:2
  • Believe the Biblical doctrine that their bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit and therefore are to be kept pure
  • Must not engage in sex outside of traditional Christian marriage
  • Cannot use tobacco or illegal drugs in any form, or abuse legal drugs or alcohol

 How To Apply

  • Apply here. In your cover letter, introduce yourself and explain why this position is of interest to you, and why you would be a great fit.
  • Please include links to apps you’ve built or anything else that makes you look good, and describe your role in building those apps. (If they’re internal, you can skip the link part.)
  • If you have a prepared resume, attach it in PDF form. If you don’t have a resume because you aren’t even sure you’re looking to change jobs, that’s fine! An informal list of your work and education history are all we’re looking for. Plus, you’ll see at our site we ask for a lot of the same info anyway.
  • Please complete the following questions, and include them with your cover letter. This shouldn’t take you very long.
    • What are your two strongest programming languages? Is there another language that you’re curious to learn next?
    • If you were interviewing a prospective candidate for this position, what would be a good interview question to ask to find out if a candidate really knew their stuff?
    • In a 2-3 sentences, what has your life with Jesus looked like over the last 3 weeks? There’s no wrong answer.

There will be a few other things if we get past the first interview, but we’ll cover that later. We even like doing our hiring on an iterative basis.

How to apply:
boards.greenhouse.io/christiancareministry/jobs/1215334

items.content:
Senior Back-End Engineer

Company: Mailshake

You'll join a small engineering team and work alongside our tech co-founder. You'll share ownership in the smooth running of many aspects of the Mailshake system including solving challenges related to scaling, refactoring, building integrations to other products, enhancing our API, fixing bugs, creating new features, and more. Experience with email deliverability is a big plus, but not required.

Our team is 100% remote, so we work fairly independently. We love to chat on Slack and Hangouts though and we meet up ~3 times a year. Each person is empowered to make improvements and is trusted to follow-up and fix issues that arise. Our deployment infrastructure is fully automated and sourced from pull requests in Github. 

We're looking for a positive person who can express themselves and their ideas in clear, constructive ways and respond well to feedback. 

To us, a great engineer:

  • Can strike the right balance between creating maintainable, well-tested code and releasing improvements. In other words, "perfect" is the enemy of good, but no one wants to work on sloppy code.
  • Can solve some issues without writing any code at all. There are whole classes of problems that have an engineering solution but could just as easily be solved by presenting the app in a clearer way.
  • Isn't afraid of rewrites. Sometimes you learn so much about the problem space by just getting something out there that writing it a second time comes with massive improvements.

TECH:

  • Node.js / TypeScript
  • MySQL
  • AWS

CULTURE:

Our team is foremost focused on thrilling end-users and creating value for the company. A close second is ensuring the code base is fun and efficient to work on. We have maternity/paternity leave, flexible schedules, and other perks that come with a fully remote company. Mailshake has taken zero outside investment -- we are profitable, bootstrapped, and proud.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • US-based strongly preferred
  • 5+ years experience
  • Excellent English and communication skills
How to apply:
Apply here: angel.co/mailshake/jobs/289412-senior-back-end-engineer

items.content:
Technical Lead


Clevertech


## DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Tech Lead for our new exciting projects with ambitious clients.

What can you expect?


* Some of the most ambitious and exciting projects
* See a recent hard problem we had to solve: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nAUsLliiukM
* A dedicated team of experienced developers that you are responsible for and have control over
* The ability to negotiate scope based on what we discover on the project
* Support from a dedicated devops team
* Support from a bizdev team

## REQUIREMENTS

* You have managed a team of 4-6 developers
* You want to keep coding a majority of the time
* Has experience as a senior engineer and can confidently approach challenges with your language and tools of choice, whether it's Python, Java, Node.js, etc.
* You have led client meetings to discover requirements
* You work in EST/PST, you can be located anywhere
* You are able to travel to USA for client meetings

See more jobs at Clevertech

items.title: Openly, Inc.: Senior Software Engineer - Go/Golang Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=13, mobile=1, go=25, nodejs=21, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Full-time

(Boston, MA - USA Only)

Openly is building a next-generation insurance company from the ground up. We’re questioning the way things have been done in this industry for over a hundred years with an open mind to how customers want insurance to work—everything from how insurance is quoted & sold, to the back-end operations that frustrate everyone and waste money. Insurance is one of a few remaining greenfield industries, with many interesting engineering problems that need a fresh perspective.

This isn’t something we’ve undertaken on a whim—we’ve been at this for a year, and planning for several years. We know we can do this because we’re the right mix of contrarian ideas backed by subject-matter expertise. The founding team brings executive-level experience from Liberty Mutual Insurance and Goldman Sachs, with mastery in actuarial science, computer engineering, math, and finance (MIT, Duke, and the University of Michigan). You can read more about the founders here and here.  The rest of the team--the real strength of the company--are key early hires who are experts in their respective fields of statistics, actuarial science, and engineering. In aggregate, across the company, we’ve essentially built all of this before. 

We were one of the 10 companies selected to Boston Techstars 2018 class. You can watch our Demo Day video here to learn more about what we’re building. 

We have a long runway and path to additional funding; we recently closed an oversubscribed round with a mix of amazing VCs and an exclusive group of angels made up of industry experts and executives.

 

What kind of people do we gravitate to?

As a company, we place great value on curiosity, integrity, and ownership, both as character traits in members of the team, but also in the way we approach business and technical challenges. We want people who thrive in environments where they get to wear multiple hats. We’re looking for someone who wants to spend most of their time coding—a polyglot that is comfortable using multiple languages depending on the task at hand (but need not be a wizard/expert in any one language), and an autodidact who is excited to dive into a deep and quantitative subject matter. Insurance or finance knowledge is not required.

We’re at a critical point in our company. Following a successful prototype, we’re now building the first production-version of everything. You will play a pivotal role in helping define everything from our engineering culture to the insurance product upon which customers will rely.

 

What are the responsibilities?

We’re hiring for a senior engineer role. Your primary responsibility will be to develop the backend systems that power the pricing and sale of our insurance products. This includes but is not limited to:

  • Integrating with a dozen data vendors to provide real-time information on hundreds of data points; everything from property characteristics, such as roof construction material, to weather-related data that help us predict flood risk or potential hailstorm damage.
  • Turning statistical models into production-quality code that can make pricing decisions, assessing a customer’s risk. 
  • Build a smart qualifier that decides if an applicant is eligible to be insured, while also making sure to avoid purchasing expensive data for a lost cause.
  • Make important architectural and operational decisions like microservices vs. monoliths, deployment techniques, technologies, policies, etc.
  • Build an API to allow third-party resellers to purchase insurance from us programmatically. 
  • And tons of future projects: machine learning for fraud detection, satellite/aerial imagery processing, IOT integration, etc.

 

What skills or qualifications would help you stand out?

  • Computer science, engineering, or math-focused, college degree or equivalent experience
  • You’re proficient in Go/Golang, or some other compiled programming language such as Java or C/C++
  • You’ve written code that’s been deployed to production and used by 1,000+ strangers 
  • You are a problem-solver who can balance between short-term and long-term solutions 
  • You need to have excellent communication skills
  • You are technically proficient enough to solve hard problems independently, but you understand that collaborative solutions are usually better.  You’re willing to ask for and offer help to your teammates to achieve the best solution

 

What’s in our stack?

We’re careful to select technologies that are the right fit for solving the specific problem, not just the new hotness. We also place great importance in things we know really well. It’s often the nuances in a language or technology the make or break you in the long run.

Backend/Core

  • Go
  • Postgresql

Frontend: 

  • VueJS
  • Webpack
  • NodeJs/Express

Research/Data Science

  • R
  • ArcGIS
  • Python

Infrastructure

  • Google Cloud
  • Kubernetes

 

Everything else:

This is full-time position.

Compensation is a mix of competitive salary and equity. We offer full benefits (medical, dental, vision) and contribute to your 401K.

We’re Boston-based, but we have some remote employees i.e. we’re open to any US-based applicants.

 

Job Perks: Equity + full medical benefits + 401K contribution

Apply: Send us your resume, GitHub link, or a description of recent projects, and why you'd be a good fit.

items.content:
Full-stack Software Engineers (mountain view)

(google map)

compensation: Outstanding, if you're great!
employment type: employee's choice
telecommuting okay




 

OveractDev Technology Partners is looking for a few very special software engineers.

We build software applications for Fortune 500 companies (like Amazon, Intuit, GoDaddy) and innovative, funded startups (like Lytro and Reputation Defender). We are not a software product company, we are a high-end engineering firm. Our clients count on us to solve tough problems, crack new technologies, and complete complex projects on time. We are judged by the quality of our work and our knowledge of best practices.

Let us know if this sounds interesting to you:

  • This is a job where you work from home and set your own hours.
  • This is an opportunity to be paid exactly what you are worth - measured by the productive value of your work. This is also an opportunity to dramatically increase your productive value and income.
  • This is a job with full benefits.
  • This is a job with a high "Freedom Multiplier". You work while in control of where you do it, when you do it, and with whom you do it.
  • This is a career path where your "job security" is NOT based on your position or title. Here, it is based on you developing high "personal power" - measured by your skills in Leadership, Ownership, Thinknology, Mastery of Discipline, Teamwork, and Rapport Building.

OveractDev is looking for Senior or higher Software Engineers specializing in the following:

  1. Areas: full-stack Web Application Development, iOS Development, Server-side Development, or Front-end Development
  2. Languages: Java/Spring, Ruby On Rails, Node.js, javascript, AngularJS, ObjectiveC
  3. Bonus Points: cloud deployment (AWS), Dev Ops. NoSQL

If you are up for a challenge and have at least 5-7 years of experience in one of these dev stacks, please submit your resume along with URLs to any of the following: github, LinkedIn, any published iOS apps. You won't regret it...

  • Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.
  • do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers
  • OK to highlight this job opening for persons with disabilities

items.title: Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=12, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead*
Generalist with can-do attitude required to join an exciting early stage startup building wearable technology to disrupt the events space.

Do you like integrating technologies that link the world together? Do you dream about real-world experience building large-scale applications connecting people and devices together using a variety of technologies? Are you motivated by working in a fast-paced dynamic environment?

We’re looking for a UK-based very hands-on Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead to join and help manage our 100% remote team and evolve our product.

*Role Requirements*
Good fundamental Computer Science knowledge (graph theory, matrix operations, etc)
Comfortable wearing Research, Development, and Operations hats in parallel
Architecting and building modern scalable mobile, front and back end environments
Familiarity with operational concerns (engineering-for-failure, scalability, performance)
Building systems in a mix of languages
Operating almost 100% remotely
Working with a 100% remote team across a variety of cultures and timezones
Excellent written and oral skills in both technical and colloquial English

*Desired Technical Skills*
Experience of using Bluetooth / BLE networking technologies (e.g. iBeacon, Eddystone, etc)
Experience using hosted systems like AWS and Heroku
Good Python ability (e.g. Jupyter, Numpy, Pandas) for basic matrix operations and data analysis
Good understanding of data analytics, methods, and tooling for real-time report generation
Good Node.js ability (e.g. building APIs)
Document oriented databases (ideally Mongo)
Understanding how to package an embedded mobile SDK and the support ecosystem that goes with it

*Optional Technical Skills*
Good understanding of mobile application development & deployment systems
Real-world understanding of modern message passing architectures and brokers (AMQP)
Orchestration & deployment of production / development environments to multiple cloud platforms
Cybersecurity, privacy and compliance, and infrastructure resiliency

*Distinct Advantages*
Experience with Machine Learning techniques
Knowledge of Graph Database technologies
Experience successfully working with remote teams

*Culture and Personality*
Commitment to others within a cohesive team
Solution-focused, consultative and comfortable working in a fluid environment
Curious and eager to pick up new technologies and languages quickly
Enjoys solving complex problems through creative thinking
Very comfortable working in a flexible, output-driven culture
Self-directed, nimble and proactive - constantly connecting dots and thinking of the next step
Thrives in a diverse, dynamic, and collaborative team
Able and willing to challenge thinking across all levels of the business
Loves to document


*About Hiver*
Hiver is a tech startup using wearable technology to help event marketers measure and improve engagement at their events by enabling event attendees to remember every contact they meet and quickly connect with those they find valuable. It connects the physical with the digital networking experience through intelligent technology. Hiver has been featured Forbes and The Financial Times and has also won Best New Event Tech by Exhibition News.

If you’re interested, send a note to hello@hivertech.com with your LinkedIn profile/CV with the subject line “Senior Software Engineer / Technical + Team Lead”

No agencies, please.

items.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=5, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=8, nodejs=26, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
*About Fluidly*
Fluidly is a seed stage fintech startup that launched to the public in October 2017. We’re building a new category - intelligent business finance.

We want to solve the biggest problem facing small businesses - poor cashflow. We use technology to provide real-time cashflow forecasting and automated credit control that helps small businesses and their accountants to be more confident about future cash position and to help them make better financial decisions. Fluidly plugs into accounting software packages such as Xero, QuickBooks and Sage and combines financial data with machine learning techniques to produce a cashflow forecast that requires absolutely no modelling.

We’ve recently been selected for the FinTech50 2018 “Hot 10” list and we are really excited that we’re one of 12 finalists for the Nesta Open Up challenge, designed for companies who are transforming small business banking.

Within the accounting industry we’ve been nominated for the AccountingWeb Forecasting, Planning & Analysis Software of the Year and Innovation of the Year. We’ve also recently been featured in the Sunday Times, the Telegraph and Wired and have been described as “one of the true disruptors of the fintech industry”.

Fluidly is backed by some of the UK’s leading technology investors and we have a diverse, top-tier team across the board, drawn from leading firms and universities. Our Founder/CEO is a serial entrepreneur, recently awarded an OBE for services to Business: https://www.linkedin.com/in/carolineplumb/

*About the role*
You will be reporting to the CTO and will be a senior member of the engineering team. Initially, your job is to help us focus on scaling out the product as we bring on more users. You must be comfortable working across the stack, implementing UI features and scaling our infrastructure and databases as the amount of data we handle increases. You will also be involved in monitoring and management of our services. It’s a small team and we all need to help each other out - this helps us all communicate better.

You’ll have significant experience building production software and thoroughly understand the quirks of web development, ideally with React.js and Node.js. You will also have been deep into the data tier and will be comfortable tuning SQL and Mongo queries, identifying bottlenecks in distributed systems and fixing them, and automating platform-related maintenance tasks. On the front end, you should be able to build out a feature so that it just works (don’t worry, we have a designer who will make sure that it is pretty and user-friendly!).

Technology wise, the solution is a full stack javascript (React + Node) monolithic application. We aim to add other tech such as golang, clojure and microservices to the stack as we scale, but for now productivity is our main priority so we are keeping things simple.

*Interview process*

*Skype call*
A short conversation of 15-30 minutes to find out a little bit more about you and tell you all about the company and what we are trying to achieve.

*Take home technical exercise*
Everyone hates technical exercises so we want this to be as painless as possible. We have a standard exercise that will take 1-2 hours depending on experience - you can do this at home on your own equipment without a stranger standing over you.

*On site interview*
You will bring in your technical exercise and we’ll talk through your solution and your experience more generally. After that we will do a pair programming exercise that’ll take about an hour.

*Meet the Team*
Depending on our / your schedules this might be a on different day to the technical interview. Come and meet the rest of the team and ask us anything.

*Compensation*

* The most competitive salary we can afford. We are an early stage startup and have to make our seed funding last. This means we can’t afford to compete directly on salary. As we grow, we will close this gap quickly. Dependent on experience (DOE).
* Meaningful equity. We want people to have a serious stake in the business so that all of our interests are aligned. It’s your baby too. DOE.
* 25 days holiday - and we will make you take it. Sure, there will be some long days, but burnout is not big or clever.
* Limitless challenge and scope for development.
* As much of our time as you need. You professional growth is important to us, and we want to help you to be awesome. It’s not just technical, Caroline will be helping build your commercial and business skills too, if that’s something you are interested in.
* Sensible problem that will add real value to real people. This isn’t an HBO parody company.
* Flexible working where possible. We like being in the office because it should be fun. All the same if you need to leave early on ${DAY} to make the school run, that’s no problem.
* All the crisps (and fruit) you can eat.


You can learn a little more about us here:

https://www.accountingweb.co.uk/tech/tech-pulse/fluidlys-top-10-partnership-shows-professions-ai-appetite

https://www.managementtoday.co.uk/why-entrepreneur-turned-down-richard-branson-mckinsey-start-own-business/entrepreneurs/article/1463042

https://www.managementtoday.co.uk/why-entrepreneur-turned-down-richard-branson-mckinsey-start-own-business/entrepreneurs/article/1463042

items.content:
Blockchain Developer

Location: Remote Singapore
Role and job type: Full-time

Job Description

We are looking for a Back-end developer who has a strong interest in blockchain technology,
open-source, decentralization, security, and testing. You can work autonomously, have a strong
integrity and are up for the challenge to build a more efficient future.

You will join the Request Network Foundation team, and specifically the Protocol Team, which is
part of the YCombinator network. We share strong values and have been working together for
several years.

Responsibilities

  • Develop the Request Network protocol by adding new features, new currencies and improve
    scalability through research on Plasma and Tendermint
  • Implement and improving our JS library, helping support our nodes architecture
  • Help educating our community about how to build on Request
  • Contribute to a decentralized payment protocol built on the blockchain

Qualifications

  • Passionate about creating and releasing projects, as well as learning new languages
  • Be able to identify relations between parts of complex projects
  • Be able to demonstrate a deep understanding of the blockchain architecture
  • Hold a Master’s in computer science or an equivalent field (STEM)
  • Proven analytical and proactive problem solving skills
  • Experience with modern development (ES6, Typescript, NodeJS, etc.). Knowledge of Solidity
    and Web3JS library is a plus
  • Optional: You have the skills to recreate the Rick and Morty Portal Gun and an opinion on how
    to avoid being trapped into one of the Black Mirror scenarios of the future

Location: Singapore for six months, one of the major European capitals afterwards.
Part-time remote work possible after a while.

Salary range

Competitive

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=40, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Node.js Developer


Roostermoney

ABOUT ROOSTERMONEY
RoosterMoney is a pocket money & allowance tracking app that helps parents teach their kids the value of money in a digital age. Simple, progressive and gameful, we bring to life all the sound traditional financial principles we were brought up with (or wish we were!) and make managing money smart, fun & relevant for the modern world.
We believe the world would be a better place if we all talked about money a little earlier on in life. Research shows that our money habits are formed by the age of seven. Thats a pretty amazing opportunity to help give kids a head-start in building habits that will stick with them for life.


WHY ROOSTERMONEY?
Hundreds of thousands of families have downloaded the RoosterMoney app since our launch in January 2016 and we have over 51 currencies being used by children around the world. RoosterMoney has been featured in The Times, Telegraph, Guardian, Wall Street Journal, New Zealand Herald to name a few. Weve been on CNBC and are considered experts in our field.
We are now expanding across a number of markets and looking for a talented and motivated node.js developer to join our team to help us raise our game and achieve even more amazing things. We have a generous share option scheme as we believe that everyone within the company should share in the success they help build.


THE ROLE:
We're looking for a Node JS developer who has held mid-senior positions on engineering teams. They will operate with a high level of autonomy, ensuring impeccable reliability and care deeply about building applications with well thought out architecture.
Working across the RoosterMoney platform as a whole within our small but growing product team (currently 8), the successful candidate will be building something that is used by families around the world. This is the perfect role for someone who enjoys building solutions that are both highly scalable and focused on user experience. The right candidate is someone who takes pride in shipping quality code that is easy to test, maintain and build on.
We are a small team so its important that the successful candidate isnt just technically highly competent but is a good cultural fit.

APPLY IF YOU WANT TO:
* Work closely with a small group of determined, like-minded people to reshape the way families talk and engage with money around the world.
* Play a critical role in the development of our platform.
* Take ownership of impactful new functionality.
* Develop robust deployment and testing processes.
* Share your knowledge and passion with the rest of the team in making the platform best in class.



Benefits

In addition to a competitive Salary:
* Work with a fun, passionate team building something awesome
* 25 days holiday
* Pension Scheme
* Employee Option Scheme
* Remote working considered as long as you can spend 20% of your time in the office (e.g a few days a month).

See more jobs at Roostermoney

Powerinbox

If you join us, what will you do?


* Work with sales and clients to understand business needs and translate them into actionable technical solutions

* Assist sales in client calls with answering technical questions

* Propose product enhancements and features to meet client needs

* Make technical presentations to clients

* Troubleshoot inbound issues for clients

* Play key technical role in the launch of core and future products and features

* Participates in various stages of product release cycle from requirement gathering, design, development, to testing and release

In order to be great at your job, you’ll need

* Exceptional organization and prioritization skills

This is extra, but if you have it, it will make us happy

items.title: Applications Engineer PSaaS
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Applications Engineer Psaas


Auth0


Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!


Many of our largest customers rely on the Auth0 Private SaaS Appliance to deliver a dedicated, isolated environment to build identity solutions in their products. This team is responsible for building the tools, processes and services required to deliver and maintain the Auth0 platform as a virtual appliance capable of running in a customer or an Auth0 managed infrastructure. We are growing the team and are looking for an Applications Engineer to help us design and build an amazing appliance. You would be a great fit for the team if you enjoy working on challenging problems and care deeply about the product’s end user experience. Not only are we looking for a talented engineer we are looking for someone who will contribute to our culture.


The team responsibilities: The team has two main responsibilities. First, we aim to deliver world-class services and tools that make it simple and enjoyable to manage and maintain the appliance. Second, we ensure all the features available to our customers in the cloud offering are available to our appliance customers. We care deeply about the experience our customers have when managing and maintaining the appliance as well as ensuring the quality of the Auth0 service being delivered.


As an Applications Engineer you will play a critical role in helping the team achieve our goals by focusing on:


* Improving PSaaS Maintenance Support - designing and implementing services and tools to support Auth0 Private SaaS installations.

* Auth0's Public Cloud Feature Parity - working with other Auth0 teams to deliver and customize product features to be packaged with the appliance.

* Development Tools - build tools to help our team implement new appliance features, but also simplify the development experience for other teams to use the appliance to test and verify their product features operate on the appliance.




As an Applications Engineer you will be:


* Designing and implementing tooling (web applications, APIs, etc) to improve experience of managing and maintaining the appliance.

* Working with other engineering teams to ensure product features function on the appliance. This may require working with other teams to re-implementing features or pieces of features to be compatible with the appliance runtime.

* Designing and implementing tools to improve the developer experience with working on the appliance.




You'd be a good fit if you:


* Have a thorough understanding of security principles and concerns.

* Have experiences with building software and services, with distributed systems complexities and their challenges.

* Have an understanding of the web platform.

* Are passionate about building systems that are highly reliable, secure, maintainable and scalable.

* Are customer focused.

* Enjoy defining and implementing APIs (e.g. REST, RPC, etc).

* Enjoy working on a highly collaborative, dynamic and remote team.




Also useful if you:


* Are familiar with Node.js, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch, and PostgreSQL.

* Have knowledge of networking and infrastructure.

* Are familiar with web or systems development.

* Have experience running applications in containers (e.g. Docker).




Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will confirm work authorization for candidates residing in the United States.

See more jobs at Auth0

items.content:
Solidity Developer

Location: Remote Remote
Role and job type: Contractor

Job Description

One amazing thing Saito can do, as a PKI network, is function as a payment channel layer for other chains. We need an experienced solidity dev to help us write solidity contracts to improve our demo functionality, and eventually use Ethereum as a native-level token for the next-generation distributed Internet applications we are building.

The current demo works: but is not optimized and is slow. Specifically the Keythereum NodeJS module takes 30-40 seconds to create a keypair. We estimate this is a 10 to 20 hour project for a knowledgable ETH dev. We have working code that creates N-party payment channels.

If you are interested in helping, please check out our working demo: https://apps.saito.network.

We also have a video run through of the demo: http://org.saito.tech/payment-channels-demo/

We need a browser-friendly NPM module that does the following:

  • creates ETH public / private keypair
  • create smart contracts through some API (browsers can’t run ETH full nodes)
  • send transactions to those smart contracts through some API

We have a 5 eth bounty on this task. Please contact us to talk in more depth, specifically about scope, and to check that the project is not already underway.

Salary range

5 ETH (est) on completion

items.content:
Blockchain Engineer

Location: Remote Bangkok
Role and job type: Full-time

Job Description

We are looking for an additional blockchain engineer who will be responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting our distributed blockchain-based network. Your primary responsibility will be analyzing currently related technologies, designing blockchain technology around our business models, and leading to the building and launching of a blockchain network.

Engineering skills:

  • Deep understanding of blockchain technology on a code and math level
  • Strong understanding of Algorithms and Data Structures
  • Experience working with cryptographic protocols.
  • Familiarity with P2P network principles
  • Strong software engineer with proven industry experience
  • Highly skilled in any of the following languages: C++, Java, GoLang, Node.js, Python, Solidity
  • Experience with setting up blockchain nodes
  • Experience writing secure Smart Contracts
  • Experience with enterprise level applications
  • Test driven developer

Soft skills:

  • Agile development comfortable
  • Self-motivated
  • Self organised
  • Work effectively with remote teams and co-workers
  • Clear and open communicator
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken
  • Proven track record of always learning and growing
  • Proactive attitude

Why work at IAP:

  • A funded startup with multiple investors
  • Founding Team Slots still available. High potential upside. In addition to highly competitive salaries, key employees can receive valuable employee stock options.
  • Flexible working environment
  • Fully remote working available
  • Startup culture where everyone matters and can make a big impact
  • Work in an ultra-high growth environment solving interesting problems, there is never a boring moment
  • Fast growth also means there are many opportunities for rapid advancement
  • Optional cryptocurrency remuneration
  • Optional relocation to Bangkok, Thailand

Salary range

Competitive

We are a remote-first, engineering-driven company. We have a culture of trust, transparency, and tireless personal growth. We are looking for experienced Software, CI/CD, and DevOps Engineers, as well as Tech Leads, to help us scale our platform.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=13, mobile=1, go=6, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About X-Team

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia, that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary teams of developers from around the world.

We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live.

We are also a community of people dedicated to unleashing our potential. We’ve fostered a unique, active lifestyle and culture around this idea that continues to attract thousands of developers to apply every day.

We proactively support our developers, fund their learning and growth, connect them in roaming hacker housesaround the world, and give them a remote environment that motivates and inspires them on a daily basis. While other companies merely place and drop their talent, we provide unified teams of developers centered around the same beliefs, values, and lifestyle. 

We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age and aid them in being able to do so properly with the right people. We work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., Coinbase, Google, Twitter and more…

About You:

  • Experience with C/C++, Go, Java, Node.js or Python.
  • Experience with relational and/or NoSQL databases.
  • Experience working on Linux/Unix platforms.
  • Experience working with cryptographic protocols.
  • Experience working with blockchain and cryptocurrency.
  • Strong passion for Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.

Nice to have:

  • Experience with working remotely
  • Familiar/involved with open­ source projects

Personal:

  • Independent, self-motivated
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken
  • Proven track record of always learning and growing
  • Proactive attitude
  • Possess a spirit of generosity

Perks:

  • Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox, Kaplan, Coinbase.. 
  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.
  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.
  • Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to learn new skills together in study groups, join clubs (photography, gaming, etc.) and get free camera equipment/games/conferences/courses/massages/etc., charitable fundraisers, fitness & yoga programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you're a remote developer.
  • We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day. 

Who is X-Team meant for?

A potential X-Teamer is a freelance developer with experience working on large-scale, remote teams and projects. They are self-motivated, proactive, and have a strong team spirit. If you're tired of the traditional freelancing platforms, you'll be happy to hear that we’re so much more. X-Team is a community of like-minded individuals, carefully chosen to ensure that they can become part of the community of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not merely a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together while becoming more motivated than they've ever been.

How long does your vetting/interview process take?

It varies depending on our immediate needs and how quickly you respond to our questions and requests. On average, it takes 1-3 weeks.

More importantly though, after a decade of interviewing developers, we've learned how important it is to respect people's time. We will only ever ask for more of your time if we think you are a potentially good fit, rather than waste your time having you jump through unnecessary hoops.

items.content:
Delivery Architect Technical Lead


Nearform

What your day looks like

Today, like every day, is going to be busy; you grab a cup of coffee and turn on your monitor. You check your calendar and have your daily standup with the development team to check on sprint progress. After that, you have a call with the client to groom the backlog. Then you walk over to the deli you love and grab some lunch. Your afternoon is a mix of collaborative problem solving across all areas of the stack, code reviews, and above all what you like best, coding!

What you’ll be doing
At nearForm, we work with international clients who are industry leaders in their respective fields. Our role is to help them build solutions and platforms; help them to launch new product ventures and fundamentally change how they operate.

As a Delivery Architect (DA) you lead a highly skilled multidisciplinary team; typically consisting of designers, front-end and back-end experts, DevOps engineers, and also members of the client team. This mix follows a modern agile development methodology where we run 2-week sprints with a defined backlog, daily standups, weekly demos, sprint planning and sprint retros; all with as little ceremony as necessary.
This is a varied role with your time being shared across Leadership tasks, Story definition and Specification, Sprint Management, DevOps processes, Technical Oversight and of course Development.

This is a key role where you provide management and leadership on a project; fully supported by the nearForm technical directors and the management team.

What we ask of you

Delivery:



7+ years experience developing at a software architect level



Proven track record of delivering software applications


Experience in managing client expectations



Experience working with an Agile Methodology


Willing to work across the delivery landscape which includes Development, Support and Deployment





Soft Skills:



Demonstrated leadership abilities



Ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment


Excellent analytical and multitasking skills



Fluent English & outstanding communication skills (written and oral)


Continuous learning mindset



Located in Ireland, the United Kingdom or the United States


Availability for short-term travel on a semi-regular basis



Fluent in English




Technology:



Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and tools



Experience with Full-stack JavaScript development including Node.js and React.js






Experience with Ajax, JSON, RESTful web services, SQL and document-oriented databases



Modern DevOps mindset with experience in Architecture to Infrastructure development, CI and Tooling, TechOps, InfoSec and Pentest support and Production Deployment support


Experience with Cloud architecture, administration and Systems Integration including tools such as Terraform and Ansible, AWS, Docker and Kubernetes



Knowledge of best practices and design patterns






Security awareness throughout the stack



Knowledge of Versioning tools, in particular, GIT


Experience Testing and Debugging





What you'll get
We have a genuine dedication to work/life balance. You can work from home and build a schedule that fits your style. We understand how important family is, so our flexible environment allows you to work around what matters - school run, no problem! On top of this, we offer Marriage leave, Birthday Leave, The Wellness Hub, Knowledge perks and many other benefits such as Healthcare.

See more jobs at Nearform

items.content:
JavaScript Technical Lead


Clevertech

 verified
## DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Tech Lead for a new exciting project with enterprise clients. Enterprise clients means your code will actually be used by millions of people, however tech choices are made within constraints. Can you do that?

## REQUIREMENTS

* You have mobile app development experience for a significant enterprise
* You have managed a team of 4-6 developers
* You want to keep coding a majority of the time in Java, Javascript, and/or Ionic
* You have led client meetings to discover requirements
* You work in PST, you can be located anywhere
* You are able to travel to USA for client meetings

## BENEFITS

#### Own Your Time
We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

#### Recharge Time
We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

#### Care For Yourself
You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance, or joining a gym!

#### Focused Work
You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

#### Learn at your edges
We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.
And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

#### Clevertech Swag
And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out [clevertech.careers](http://clevertech.careers).

[Clevertech Culture Video](https://youtu.be/z5daft3oGjM)

See more jobs at Clevertech

items.content:
Teachers Pay Teachers| NYC (New York City) | ONSITE, REMOTE | Full-Time

Teachers Pay Teachers is a community of millions of educators who come together to share their work, their insights, and their inspiration with one another. We are the first and largest open marketplace where teachers share, sell, and buy original educational resources. Since we've started, authors on Teachers Pay Teachers have earned over $300M. Here's a bit more of the backstory (https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/06/technology/a-sharing-econ...). Our engineering culture focuses on Fearless Development (http://engineering.teacherspayteachers.com/2015/10/11/the-fe...), curiosity, learning, and autonomy.

We're currently managing our AWS infrastructure with Terraform and our servers with Chef. All of our newer services are deployed in Docker containers and managed by Kubernetes. We use a mix of Elixir/Phoenix, PHP, NodeJS, React, and Python to write our services.

If you want to learn more about us, check us out on The Muse: https://www.themuse.com/companies/teacherspayteachers/

To see what we're hiring for, you can check out our careers page: https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Careers

Interested? Contact Chris Hondl, CTO/Co-founder, chris@finaleinventory.com

MongoDB

items.content:
Plaid | Software Engineer | San Francisco, CA; Salt Lake City, UT | equity + benefits | REMOTE, Full-time, https://plaid.com/

* About Me *

Hello HN! My name is Jean-Denis Greze and I'm the Head of Engineering at Plaid. I helped grow Dropbox from 100 engineers to 600+. I joined Plaid because I believe in our mission to empower the consumer financial revolution and believe we are uniquely positioned to drive change in the industry.

* About Us *

We provide a single API on top of the U.S. financial system and help companies like Venmo, Coinbase, Lending Club, Square Cash, and Robinhood handle banking data. Being at the epicenter of Fintech allows us to pursue everything from the Bitcoin frenzy to the revolution happening in Home Mortgages. We are a mature and enthusiastic workplace excited to grow from 120 (48 engineers) to 200+ employees in 2018.

* About You *

We're looking for experienced software engineers with 3+ years experience in SRE, Backend, Product, Security, or Data Science. Our tech stack includes Node.js, Typescript, and Go, and while we love experience with these technologies we get excited about anyone comfortable stepping into a new environment. We value transparency, humility, and intellectual honesty.

Most of the team is in SF, but we've just opened an office in Salt Lake City and we're also building out a distributed team. If you're an iOS or Android engineer and excited to help own and drive improvements to our mobile SDK (Link) and client libraries, get in touch wherever you live!

* Get in Touch *

You can learn more about us at https://plaid.com/company/ and see our open roles at You can learn more about us at https://plaid.com/careers . Reach out to me directly at greze+hn@plaid.com with a sentence or two about yourself and either your LinkedIn profile or your resumé.

Tech Buzzwords: Node.js, Python, Go/Golang, Typescript, AWS, Redshift, EC2, ECS, S3, ElasticSearch, Spark.

Company Buzzwords: $60 million raised, Series B. Catered Lunch, Dinner. Health+Vision+Dental+Life, Monthly team events. Wellness + Transportation Benefits, Uber/Lyft credits. Flexible Hours/WFH. Unlimited PTO (three week minimum).

items.title: Web Developer (Full Stack) for exciting Travel startup
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
GoneRemote, an exciting Travel/HR startup, is looking for a passionate, experienced and determined Web Developer (Full Stack). If the successful applicant excels in this role, they may have the opportunity to become CTO in the future.


An MVP website has been made for testing. Now that testing has completed, the next project is to build and oversee a new interactive e-commerce website/platform.


GoneRemote is a Remote Work and Travel Program company, allowing professionals to live in, and experience different locations each month with a group of other like-minded professionals whilst continuing with their full-time job.


Job Responsibilities:
- Creating and designing a new e-commerce website including implementation of a brand house style throughout
- Planning and prototyping future applications to support new business objectives
- Deciding on the best technologies and languages for the projects you work
- Continually optimizing performance and cost of live solutions and eradicating any bugs that may occur
- Building and testing Application Program Interfaces (APIs) for applications to exchange data and enable integration of our platform with third parties
-Building and maintaining databases that support front-end services

Job Requirements:
– Candidate must have a strong understanding of UI, UX, cross-browser compatibility, general web functions and W3C standards.
– Experience in planning and delivering software platforms used across multiple products and organizational units.
– Deep expertise and hands-on experience with Web Applications and front-end programming languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript, as well as server-side frameworks for building API’s, such as NodeJS or ASP.NET.
– The flexibility and ability to work abroad for long periods of time
– Candidate must possess an ambitious, determined and ‘go-getter’ attitude, proving you can work both autonomously and as a team
-Experience working in a startup is beneficial
– BSc/BA educated

As of the nature of the company, the ideal candidate will need to have the freedom to work and live in different locations around the world at some point. The ideal candidate does not need to live in London at the time being, however, it would be a huge benefit. The job role is part-time to start with, with no salary but will you will be offered equity. This can be discussed in greater detail if successful in the interview.

Why work with us?
- The chance to get involved in an exciting new travel startup
- Opportunity to use your skills, experiences and motivations to create something from scratch
- The chance to work and travel around the world
- Equity within the company
- Potential to become CTO if successful


Please attach your CV, a cover letter stating why you would be perfect for this role and any other supporting materials (if you have any) onto this application. We are always happy to answer any questions you may have as well.

We look forward to hearing from you.

items.title: Lead Apigee Technical Architect - Perficient - National, WV
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=3, go=0, nodejs=16, bigdata-ml=1, ruby=0, apple=0, java=6, gamedev=0, php=15, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Lead Apigee Technical Architect

Company: Perficient
Location: National, WV
$115,000 - $147,000 a year (Indeed estimate)



Overview



At Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too.

We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled.

About Our EPS - API Practice
Perficient’s Emerging Platform Solutions (EPS) combines Perficient’s API Management, Integration and IoT practices. Our centers of excellence around API/SOA/Integration combine deep technology and management consulting skills with the experience to deliver business value to our clients.

Perficient’s Emerging Platform Solutions (EPS) – API Management practice delivers enterprise-level solutions and services in the API and API management space which has quickly become one of the cornerstones of the modern IT landscape. Our group has been at the forefront of Perficient’s integration services for the last 15 years delivering large-scale, mission-critical middleware implementations in healthcare, telecom, energy, and many other verticals. The extension of APIs and API management is a natural evolution for the skills of our talented team of consultants.

Our EPS – API Management practice is a dynamic, fast-growing team that combines deep expertise with in-depth understanding of APIs and API Management, the value it provides, and the capabilities it enables in technology application areas like mobile, microservices, and IOT. Our committed and talented consultants ensures successful project delivery for customers. We speed adoption of these new technologies through reusable, time-tested frameworks and best practices. We are passionate about delivering exceptional, innovative technology solutions. Working with the team will be exciting, educational, and fun.

Perficient currently has a career opportunity for a Lead Apigee Technical Architect in our National EPS Practice. This position is located in NY, we prefer local candidates but will consider those who wish to relocate. Will also consider remote with extensive travel.

Job Overview:

As a Lead Technical Consultant you will participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle which includes estimating, technical design, implementation, documentation, testing, deployment and support of application developed for our clients. As a member working in a team environment you will work with solution architects and developers on interpretation/translation of wireframes and creative designs into functional requirements, and subsequently into technical design.

Responsibilities

  • This position is located in NY, we prefer local candidates but will consider those who wish to relocate. Will also consider remote with extensive travel.
  • Lead the technical planning & requirements gathering phases including estimate, develop, test, manage projects, architect and deliver.
  • Serve as a technical lead and mentor. Provide technical support or leadership in the development and continual improvement of service.
  • Develop and maintain effective working relationships with team members.
  • Demonstrate the ability to adapt and work with team members of various experience level.
  • Design and develop REST APIs using Apigee
  • Implement requirements of the API layer like security, custom analytics, throttling, caching, logging, monetization, request and response modifications etc. using Apigee
  • Convert web services from SOAP to REST or vice-versa, using Apigee API management platform
  • Create custom policies in Java, JavaScript, Node js, Python etc in Apigee
    Build and create shared flows for Error Handling, Security and other scenarios as deemed necessary
  • Design and develop API platform to connect to various disparate backend systems for seamless data exchange
  • Build API developer portal for service providers to on board app developers, add API documentation and customize using drupal
  • Experience in Drupal portal with ability to extend functionality using Drupal modules
  • Create REST API documentation using Swagger and YAML or similar tools
  • Standardize the CI/CD setup for Apigee for automated deployment
  • Automation of API testing using cucumber apickli or other testing frameworks
  • Work as Dev-Ops for all Apigee related requests.

Qualifications

  • This position is located in NY, we prefer local candidates but will consider those who wish to relocate. Will also consider remote with extensive travel.
  • Passionate coders with 3-5 years of application development experience.
  • More than 3 years of experience in Apigee and any API Management Tool
  • Strong hands on experience with one of the programming language like Java, Javascript., NodeJS
  • Strong software design and programming fundamentals of JAVA and REST Architecture
  • Client facing or consulting experience highly preferred.
  • Skilled problem solvers with the desire and proven ability to create innovative solutions.
  • Flexible and adaptable attitude, disciplined to manage multiple responsibilities and adjust to varied environments.
  • Future technology leaders- dynamic individuals energized by fast paced personal and professional growth.
  • Phenomenal communicators who can explain and present concepts to technical and non-technical audiences alike, including high level decision makers.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in MIS, Computer Science, Math, Engineering or comparable major.
  • Solid foundation in Computer Science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design.
  • Knowledge and experience in developing software using agile methodologies.
  • Proficient in authoring, editing and presenting technical documents.
  • Ability to communicate effectively via multiple channels (verbal, written, etc.) with technical and non-technical staff.
  • This is a role with our National Practice and will require extensive travel.
Perficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work.

More About Perficient

Perficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000 and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient and its Perficient Digital agency deliver vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions.

Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Perficient's professionals serve clients from a network of offices across North America and offshore locations in India and China. Traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, Perficient is a member of the Russell 2000 index and the S&P SmallCap 600 index.

Perficient is an award-winning Premier Level IBM Business Partner, a Microsoft National Service Provider and Gold Certified Partner, an Oracle Platinum Partner, an Adobe Business Solution Partner, and a Salesforce Platinum Consulting Partner.

Perficient is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national, origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Disclaimer: The above statements are not intended to be a complete statement of job content, rather to act as a guide to the essential functions performed by the employee assigned to this classification. Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties of the position at any time.

#LI-ST1

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=16, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=19}
items.content:
Full-stack JavaScript Developer

Location: Ann Arbor Michigan
Role and job type: Full-time

Job Description

We’re looking for a rockstar to lead the design and development of our tech platform.

Must:

  • Be interested in crypto
  • Combine the art of design with the art of programming to build scalable, responsive, and clean UIs
  • Write compact and reusable code for cross-platform use
  • Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability
  • Have great communication skills
  • Be able to work in an ambitious, fast-paced startup
  • Think big and bring in your own ideas

Skills:

  • JavaScript (ES6+)
  • Web & mobile development (React, React Native)
  • Back-end development (Node.js, GraphQL, MongoDB)
  • Bonus: Smart contract development (C++ / Solidity)

Perks:

  • Be a leader!
  • Earn equity in a rapidly growing business!
  • No jerks allowed!
  • Help build the cryptocurrency revolution!

Salary range

Equity + Negotiable Salary

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=12, go=0, nodejs=54, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=6, java=3, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=22}
items.content:
We’re looking for a proactive full-stack developer with good experience on a broad range of skills to help us maintain our powerful platform and build new features with the latest JavaScript and native technologies and frameworks on the market.

Fliplet is a cloud-based app builder with JavaScript to its core, both on the backend and frontend. The candidate must be good at problem solving and debugging, highly proficient with Node.js and SQL and must be familiar with AWS load-balanced backend architectures that span across multiple geographic locations.

The candidate must also have good knowledge on building and submitting both native apps (iOS and Android) and hybrid mobile apps with Cordova.

The ideal candidate must have:
- Excellent communication skills
- Excellent debugging, problem solving and performance analysis skills
- 2+ years Node.js and Express experience building backend systems and RESTful APIs
- Strong Javascript skills including: Promises, ES6, package/module management (npm), functional programming (lodash)
- Good at writing internal and public documentation, see https://developers.fliplet.com
- Good experience with PostgreSQL or MySQL
- Good Devops experience with AWS
- Good experience with Building native mobile apps (iOS and Android)
- Great experience with Building hybrid apps with Cordova
- Experience with signing and submitting apps to app stores
- Experience with Docker
- Experience integrating with external services and APIs
- Experience with Vue.js or another reactive JS framework like React
- Experience with continuous integration and deployment (CircleCI)
- Experience with automated testing and TDD/BDD

Preferred experience but not required:
- Testing and debugging native apps (iOS & Android)
- Server-less and microservices-based infrastructures (e.g. AWS Lambda)
- Monitoring and alarming on infrastructure with AWS and Datadog
- Queueing systems (job/workers queues) such as Redis
- Maintains or published/contributed to open-source npm packages
- Windows 10 app creation using JScript and Cordova

Fliplet is based near Old Street in London, but we are also open to candidates based in Europe (no more than +1 hour ahead of UK time), who have previous experience of working remotely.

Salary is between £50-80,000, and is dependent on your experience and where you will be based.

No recruiters please.

items.title: Full Stack Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=24, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=27}
items.content:
*Company*

Code & Wander is a digital product studio with a passion for building beautiful and scalable web solutions for startups, brands and ourselves. We’re an adventurous bunch of people that enjoy the benefits of traveling and working remotely whilst still having an office in London. If you’re a dropout, rule-breaker, ex-founder, backpacker, or a talented multi-disciplined product individual, you’ll feel right at home.


*Description*

We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer to help develop web solutions for clients and internal products, whilst working closely with designers and peers in the team.

• You will develop applications primarily using JavaScript for both frontend (React, Redux) and backend (Node, Express, MongoDB), deploying to Heroku or AWS

• Top candidates for this role would be full-stack JavaScript developers who desire a collaborative and flexible environment in a small team, and have a high focus on producing high-quality, beautiful and robust products.


*Requirements*

• 3+ years of work experience with JavaScript technologies such as Node.js and React

• Ability to code at all levels of a web application stack

• Pair programming experience, willing to work collaboratively to both give and receive feedback

• Strong working knowledge of Git

• Ability to communicate clearly with clients, partners and project managers.

• Ability to translate technical requirements into quality programmed solutions

• Focus on self-improvement and the ability to communicate new ideas and technologies

• Hands on, passionate, persistent, and humble — you get things done without an ego

• Willingness to travel and work


*Nice-To-Haves*

• Experience with mobile applications - React Native

• Background in design (knowledge of Sketch/Framer is a plus

• Keen eye for design, user experience and product development

• Knowledge of AWS EC2, Elastic Beankstalk, Code Deploy, VPS

• Knowledge of ReasonML/GraphQl


*Benefits*

• Workations – enjoy company paid trips with the team whilst participating in activities, bonding and drinking (…and a bit of work to keep our clients happy)

• Ability to travel and work remotely

• Discounts on entertainment, retail, travel and more (Apple, Amazon, Tesco, Odeon, Cineworld, Nike and more…)


*No Recruiters*

Applications or emails from recruiters will have their addresses submitted to an endless supply of spam

items.title: Technical Co-Founder / Blockchain CTO
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=3, nodejs=21, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=19}
items.content:
Technical Co-Founder / Blockchain CTO

Location: Remote Remote
Role and job type: Full-time

Job Description

Do you consider yourself a full-stack dev with architecture skills and passionate about Blockchain technology? Do you want to be part of something that will provide seekers new pathways to market relevant skill development, connecting global employers and job seekers in new ways? Do you think that the blockchain ecosystem data transparency and token economy is one of its greatest advantages? If Yes, to all of the above we are looking for a partner that is ready to architect a system from the ground up.

Required Skills:
Blockchain & Software Development

Involved in development, testing, release, support and maintenance activities of internal / external web applications using Java,Go, Node.js, Express, HTML, CSS & jQuery, AngularJS/2

  • Develop the prototype/test-net for an initial pilot
  • Hire and oversee the engineering team
  • Build and support the IF WHEN THEN smart contract solution
  • Lead strategic planning to achieve business goals by identifying and prioritizing development initiatives and setting timelines for the evaluation, development and deployment of products.
  • Participate in the community through blog posts, panels and presentations
  • True partner to the CEO who helps develop the project culture and launch our Initial Coin Offering (ICO).
  • Experience with new blockchain technologies, especially strong interest in EOS, is a big plus.
  • Ideally the technical partner has at least one highly successful product and experience in global marketplaces and payment systems.
  • Has demonstrated contributions as a thought leader, Blockchain technology and a passion for understanding emerging technologies with insight into where those technologies can be integrated into business solutions
  • Proven experience as a CTO or role that would lead to qualifications for a CTO position, and ideally some experience in social networks.

Soft Skills

  • Strong interpersonal, communication and relationship development skills
  • Proactive attitude towards identifying and resolving issues
  • Prior experience working in a startup environment highly preferred
  • Strong english speaker
  • Works well in a remote environment

Nice to have

  • Expert understanding of external competitive landscape in the non formal education ecosystem, ability to understand, build tools for ecosystem partners for more seamless integrations into the marketplace and social network.
  • Successful startup experience and community building a plus.
  • Active Github contributor

We offer:

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunities to reshape the global education ecosystem in high value and hyper growth sectors
  • Opportunity to enter the blockchain industry, work the EOS Blockchain and develop new skills
  • Extremely passionate, platform design thinking and driven team environment

5% equity; 4-year vesting schedule with a 6-month cliff
Email at ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Salary range

US$50,000 to US$60,000
